employer_name: SQUARE ONE RESOURCES sp. z o.o.About the company
technologies_expected: ['SAP Business Technology Platform', 'APIs', 'REST', 'OData', 'SOAP', 'SAP CPI', 'Grafana', 'Prometheus', 'SAP Cloud ALM']
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Solution Design & Integration
Architecture Governance & Documentation
SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)
Vendor & Stakeholder Engagement
Technology Leadership & Best Practices
Promote adoption of architectural best practices, patterns, and tools.
Drive technical decisions in line with data integrity, security, and compliance requirements (e.g., GxP, HIPAA).
Architecture Ceremonies & Collaboration
Organize and facilitate architecture ceremonies (e.g., design reviews, tech deep-dives, retros).
Foster collaboration between development, infrastructure, security, and compliance teams.
Healthcare & CGT Context
Understand specific challenges and workflows in the CGT domain, such as chain of identity/custody, PHI/PII, etc...
Ensure architectural decisions support regulatory, data privacy, and traceability needs.
End-to-End Monitoring & Observability
requirements_section:
Our requirements
5+ years of experience in solution architecture or a related field.
Hands-on experience with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) services such as Integration Suite, Extension Suite, Event Mesh.
Proven knowledge of integrating SAP and non-SAP systems using BTP tools.
Proficiency in designing enterprise and middleware integrations with APIs (REST, OData, SOAP), SAP CPI or other middleware platforms.
Understanding of regulated environments such as Healthcare and Pharma, with knowledge of GxP, HIPAA, PHI/PII, data traceability, and compliance-by-design.
Optional
Experience with monitoring and observability tools (e.g., Grafana, Prometheus, SAP Cloud ALM).
Familiarity with agile architecture practices, including ceremonies and collaboration with DevOps/SecOps teams.
Proficiency in using architecture modeling tools such as ArchiMate, C4, Sparx EA, or Lucidchart.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate business needs into scalable technical designs.
description_block:
SQUARE ONE RESOURCES sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
At Square One Poland we link IT experts with the business. With over 25 years of experience, we specialize in recruitment processes on a global scale. Despite years of experience, we still have a startup DNA and this is our advantage. Our offices are located in London and Warsaw, however, we can reach clients from all over the world, from start-ups to big worldwide corporations.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Manage asset lifecycle from procurement to disposal.
Collaborate with various teams to understand CMDB requirements.
Maintain CSDM 4.0 framework and CMDB practices.
Maintain and operate according to the SACM process and procedures.
Maintaining the integrity of the configuration management database (CMDB)
Ensures data quality, accuracy and completeness in the CMDB.
Capability of coaching and educating stakeholders about the CMDB usages.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve assets & configuration management issues.
Ensure compliance with industry standards and company policies.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Preferably, you have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT, computer science, information systems, or related field.
A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in IT Service Management (preferable asset and configuration management)
Strong understanding of ITIL frameworks and best practices
First-rate analytical and problem-solving skills
Great knowledge of ServiceNow
A curious mind with an open nature and desire to knowledge-share with others
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Good facilitation, communication and interpersonal skills
Good stakeholder management skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask.
Optional
Proven track record of managing complex IT environments.
Familiarity with Agile and DevOps methodologies (Kanban)
offered_section:
What we offer
We offer a diverse range of benefits for our employees. Here are just a few of them.
Flexible working hours
Mental health support
Free lunch at the office
Professional development
Referral bonus up to PLN 10,000
PLN 600 on a benefit platform a month

description_block:
BEC Poland
Scroll to company's profile
BEC is a financial technology company creating IT solutions for Danish banks. Together, we enable their customers to invest online, take out loans and transfer money. In other words, everything it takes to run a bank.
We have 1,700+ employees spread across five locations in Denmark and Poland. We collaborate in a flat hierarchy with a high degree of mutual trust. Here, great ideas have no rank, and we invite everybody to chip in to create the strongest banking solutions for Danish society.
additional_module_section:
What does the recruitment process look like?
Send us your CV: We want to get to know you!
Screening call: Let‚Äôs chat and see if we‚Äôre a match.
Meet your future manager and team: See who you‚Äôll be working closely with.
Personality and cognitive test: Let‚Äôs learn more about you.
Meet our talent partner and your future manager once more: Get feedback on your test results.
Time to sign the contract: We‚Äôre ready to welcome to BEC!

Educate customers on best practices and self-service solutions where applicable.

Contribute to knowledge base articles and troubleshooting guides.
Support IT policies, compliance, and security best practices.

German on at least B2 level
English on at least B2 level

Experience working in a managed services or shared services environment.
Familiarity with automation tools and scripting (PowerShell, Bash).

description_block:
ZOOLA TECH POLAND sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Zoolatech is a Software development company. Now we have around 400 team members in Ukraine, Mexico, Turkey, Poland and we continue to grow.
Zoolatech was founded on the idea of creating a harmonious, collaborative environment for all of our team members and our clients that, once they have discovered it, they will never want to leave. We are building a family-like atmosphere where clients and team members act as partners and share common goals.
Our clients are awesome people who like what they do, so we work hard to make their products incredible. We help them achieve their desires and dreams.
We work with big enterprises and small startups from the USA and Europe. Our customers make the world better in many areas: Retail, Media & Entertainment, Logistics, FinTech, Renewable Energy, Healthcare, Agriculture, Construction & Real Estate, Travel & Hospitality and High Tech.
Mission: Our mission is to create an environment of professionalism and friendliness that will provide an excellent working environment for employees and outstanding service for the clients.
At Zoolatech, everyone creates their own story: it can be about complex architecture, sports, a full and healthy life, or something completely new and exciting that you will bring to us and unite others around it.
We have values that our employees and clients share:
Extreme Ownership
- We own everything within our reach: our work, our results, our relations with coworkers and clients, our careers and professional growth
- We don't blame others and circumstances
- We face challenges, and we‚Äôre not hesitant to ask for help when needed
Learn from Failure
- We love learning and dare to try making things differently and better
- We are smart not to make the same mistake for the second time
- We prefer taking risks and actions to staying still
Speak Up
- We care for what is going on within our reach
- We know we are empowered to make a change
- We do not pretend nothing happens when we see mediocrity, injustice, or plain indifference
Zoola Clients
- We want our clients to be with us forever
- We religiously believe that the only way to our success is our clients success
- We care about the products we work on, and about people who use it
Live a Full, Healthy Life.
- We measure success by the value delivered, not the time spent working
- We care about our physical and mental health
- We believe that happy and healthy people are more productive.

responsibilities_section:

description_block:
Sofidel Poland Sp. z.o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
The Sofidel Group is one of the leading manufacturers of paper for hygienic and domestic use worldwide. Established in 1966, the Group has subsidiaries in 12 countries ‚Äì Italy, Spain, the UK, France, Belgium, Germany, Sweden, Poland, Hungary, Greece, Romania and the USA ‚Äì with more than 6,000 employees, net sales of 2,173 million Euros (2020) and a production capacity of over one million tonnes per year (1,428,000 tonnes in 2020). ‚ÄúRegina‚Äù, its most well-known brand, is present on almost all the reference markets. Other brands include: Softis, Le Tr√®fle, Sopalin, Thirst Pockets, KittenSoft, Nalys, Cosynel, Lycke, Nicky, Papernet. A member of the UN Global Compact and the international WWF Climate Savers programme, the Sofidel Group considers sustainability a strategic factor with regards to growth and is committed to reducing its impact on natural capital and maximising social benefits, setting as objective the creation of shared added value for all stakeholders. Sofidel‚Äôs greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reduction targets to 2030 have been approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) as consistent with reductions required to keep warming to well-below 2¬∞C, in line with the goals of the Paris Agreement.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
The latest technology in an innovative environment, combined with our team spirit to create the best possible customer experience.
Administration, optimisation and maintenance of our cloud, network and server infrastructure, taking into account service requirements, operational aspects and cost-effectiveness.
Responsibility for the control, monitoring and capacity management of the cloud, network, security and server infrastructure to ensure trouble-free operation
Analysing and sustainably rectifying faults as part of our ITIL processes
Managing suppliers, manufacturers and service providers to evaluate and implement the optimum solution in terms of project requirements
Continuous improvement of our service orientation and ongoing technological development of the hybrid IT infrastructure
requirements_section:
Our requirements
You have successfully completed training as an IT specialist for system integration or in a comparable field and therefore have a high affinity for IT topics
Several years of professional experience, which you have ideally gained in a modern IT service company
Experience in project management and the coordination of internal and external resources
Several years of experience in VMware ESXi, Microsoft 365 enterprise landscape, Microsoft server operating systems and in the administration of advanced IT services such as backup or print platforms
High level of self-motivation in the co-design and provision of new structures and solutions as well as interest in new technologies
Motivation and interest in acquiring new subject areas and competences, such as in the environment of Citrix XenApp and Citrix ADC
Strong knowledge in monitoring and ensuring the trouble-free operation of the system and network infrastructure as well as in troubleshooting these components.
Willingness to travel occasionally
Confident communication in German and English
offered_section:

Remote or hybrid work
Life insurance
Comprehensive medical insurance package
Discount on company products
No dress code
Guaranteed annual bonus
description_block:
Weleda
Scroll to company's profile
Weleda is a Swiss-German cosmetics and pharmaceutical company that began commercial production of pharmaceuticals and skin care products in Schw√§bisch Gm√ºnd, Germany, in 1921.
Today, our natural medicines and cosmetics are available in over 50 countries. Weleda has subsidiaries in 20 countries.
We source our raw materials from all over the world.
As a co-initiator and member of the Union for Ethical BioTrade (UEBT), we ensure that strict ethical criteria are applied throughout all our natural raw material supply chains.

HigoSense Sp z o.o.

Higo is built by the best specialists in their fields‚Äîopen-minded individuals focused on results, independent, proactive, eager to experiment, and most importantly, forming a trusting team.

At HigoSense, we are transforming telemedicine, enabling every patient to receive a reliable diagnosis based on medical data without leaving home. At the same time, our comprehensive solution enhances patients‚Äô access to doctors.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities

employer_name: SQUARE ONE RESOURCES sp. z o.o.About the company
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Migrate commit check tools and custom wrappers into a standardized pre-commit framework.
Redesign and refactor Git hooks to improve maintainability and cross-team consistency.
Execute the migration of source code repositories from GitLab to Gerrit.
Implement structured test object lifecycle stages in CI to improve pipeline reliability and traceability.
Gradually decommission legacy tools (e.g., SWAT) and support the rollout of modern CI alternatives.
Cooperate closely with development teams to align CI practices with product development goals.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in CI/CD environments.
University degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
Strong scripting and automation skills using Python and Groovy (Jenkins).
Proven experience with Azure DevOps or Azure ecosystem.
Practical knowledge of CI tools and source control systems, including GitLab and Gerrit.
Experience with static code analysis tools and quality gates.
Optional
Familiarity with MongoDB, Jira (VIRA).
Basic understanding or exposure to C/C++ or Java development environments.
Previous experience in the automotive or embedded systems domain.
description_block:
SQUARE ONE RESOURCES sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
At Square One Poland we link IT experts with the business. With over 25 years of experience, we specialize in recruitment processes on a global scale. Despite years of experience, we still have a startup DNA and this is our advantage. responsibilities_section:

Researching and analyzing existing security issues, attack strategies and techniques targeting Samsung Knox
Analyzing Android/Windows applications used in attacks on Samsung Knox

Practical knowledge of Android system architecture
Practical knowledge of the code review for finding vulnerabilities
Advanced knowledge about application security

Knowledge about reverse-engineering and binary analysis of Android/Linux and Windows applications

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Develop, maintain, and optimize embedded Linux systems using Yocto Project.
Customize Linux kernel, bootloaders (U-Boot), and root filesystem for target hardware.
Integrate and configure packages, recipes, and meta-layers.
Integrate external hardware modules (e.g. LCD screens, RS485 devices, Modbus devices, USB devices etc.)
Work closely with hardware and software teams to enable new platforms and features.
Debug system issues.
Automate builds, testing, and deployment pipelines (CI/CD).
Proactive approach on system requirements in discussions with customers.
Document processes, configurations, and system architecture
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Solid experience with Yocto Project
Proficiency in C, shell scripting, Python.
Strong knowledge of Linux system internals, filesystems, and cross-compilation.
Experience with Linux kernel configuration and device tree modifications.
Familiarity with bootloaders (U-Boot), init systems (systemd/systemv), and BSP development.
Competence with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Ability to analyze and troubleshoot hardware/software integration issues.
Optional
Familiarity with embedded security (TPM2, secure boot, encrypted boot)
Exposure to CI/CD for embedded environments (Github and GitLab CI)
Experience in planning OS releases
Knowledge around EU-RED certification, pen-testing
Ansible
Rust/Golang
offered_section:
What we offer
Permanent contract
B2B - Paid holiday of 30 days/year
Remote work: Depending on your role
Private healthcare
Multisport Card
Flat startup structure with international team
description_block:
CTHINGS.CO sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
At CTHINGS.CO, we're on a mission to support the digital transformation of industries and municipalities. We design, develop, and manufacture 5G IoT hardware, software, sensors, cloud platforms, and web applications that employ bleeding-edge technology and components to monitor, capture, transmit, and analyze data. In addition, we dedicate a lot of our time to creating a robust Orchestration Platform for IoT applications. We're a diverse, multicultural, and inclusive team that is constantly evolving and expanding, and we're looking for a highly skilled and experienced professional to join us on this exciting journey.
additional_module_section:
How to apply:
Send us your CV (and optionally a cover letter) in English explaining why you decided to apply. We will be in touch if we believe you would be a good fit. Please keep in mind that we only contact a select group of candidates.
CTHINGS.CO is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Design and propose IT infrastructure configurations for new systems
Ensure system availability through high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) mechanisms (active-active, active-passive clusters)
Specify scalable architectures that allow hardware expansion (CPU, RAM, storage, server count) without modifying application code
Integrate authentication and identity management systems (e.g. Active Directory, IDM)
Design open, well-documented APIs and enable system integration via ESB and web services
Specify supporting database and system software components (e.g. MS SQL)
Optimize network communication in constrained environments (packet loss, limited bandwidth)
Manage IT environment configurations (production, failover, test), including disk space planning (1, 2, and 5 years)
Define software licensing requirements and technical parameterization (file paths, ports, DB names, etc.)
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Proven experience in designing three-tier system architectures
Hands-on knowledge of high availability and disaster recovery planning
Familiarity with MS Windows Server 2022 and Red Hat Linux 9.x (preferred)
Experience working with VMware and Red Hat OpenShift platforms
Strong understanding of network architecture (firewalls, switches, load balancers) and network optimization techniques
Ability to specify and integrate database systems such as MS SQL
Understanding of identity and access management systems and integration with enterprise tools (Active Directory, IDM)
Knowledge of data security standards and cryptographic protection of personal data in transmission
Practical experience with Web Services (SOAP/REST) and system integration through APIs
Familiarity with PowerBI and integration with office applications (MS Office)
Ability to design and document IT environment configurations and predict resource needs
Strong documentation skills and attention to infrastructure detail
Optional
Familiarity with backup and DR tools (e.g. Veritas NetBackup 10+)
Knowledge of SOA architecture and ESB platforms
Understanding of XML/CSV data exchange formats and direct SQL communication between systems
Experience in projects delivered in regulated environments (e.g. banking, insurance)
offered_section:
What we offer
Stable and long-term cooperation with very good conditions
Enhance your skills and develop your expertise in the financial industry
Work on the most strategic projects available in the market
Define your career roadmap and develop yourself in the best and fastest possible way by delivering strategic projects for different clients of ITDS over several years
Participate in Social Events, training, and work in an international environment
Access to attractive Medical Package
Access to Multisport Program
Access to Pluralsight
Flexible hours & remote work
description_block:
ITDS Polska Sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
ITDS supports financial service providers to take the next steps.
We identify what‚Äôs possible, every day. Opportunities in the areas of technology, organization, and digitization.
We see where banks, insurers, payment companies, or fintech can go and how they can get there.
That‚Äôs why we want to stimulate you to ramp up your ambition. Forget what you perceive as restraints and step towards the new reality.
ITDS in Poland - Pure player in new Technologies & Financial Industry
+300 IT implementation professionals
+20 clients in the Banking, Insurance, Payment & Fintech Industry
ITDS excels in digital strategy delivery and implementation of best-of-breed lending solutions. ITDS has delivered successful strategic projects throughout Europe since 1998. We combine the experience we‚Äôve accumulated with in-depth knowledge of technologies, business processes, and EU legislation to unlock new business opportunities.
additional_module_section:
#GETREADY to meet with us!
ITDS Business Consultants is involved in many various, innovative and professional IT projects for international companies in the financial industry in Europe. We offer an environment for professional, ambitious, and driven people.
We would like to meet you. If you are interested please apply and attach your CV in English or Polish, including a statement that you agree to our processing and storing of your personal data.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Write and test code, particularly in Rust and C for USB bootloaders, as well as bare metal programming for ARM M0/RISC-V.
Encompass reviewing peer code for best practices, triaging and resolving product/system issues across hardware, network and software, and designing debug strategies.
Demonstrate an understanding of USB data controllers, resource needs, USB 2.0/3.0 protocols, and the bring-up process for new devices.
Participate in or lead design reviews, decide on technologies, and contribute to product development from prototyping to mass production.
Contribute to documentation, adapt content based on feedback, and design and implement test cases for continuous integration.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
3 years of experience working with embedded operating systems.
Experience in triaging, debugging, and resolving system issues across software, hardware, and SoC, including designing debug strategies.
Optional
Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
1 year of experience in a technical leadership role.
Solid background in embedded systems, including bootloaders, bare metal development (ARM/RISC-V), and experience with hardware specifications and peripherals (e.g., Synopsys DWC).
Familiarity with system-level software (e.g., upstream Linux), hardware interfaces (e.g., USB), debugging tools (JTAG), and developing accessible technologies.
Expertise in software development in C and Rust, including pre- and post-silicon development and SOC bring-up.

employer_name: SQUARE ONE RESOURCES sp. z o.o.About the company
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Collaborate with stakeholders, including business analysts, project managers, and end-users, to understand their needs, objectives, and pain points.
Translate these business requirements into technical specifications and solution designs.
Design comprehensive functional and solution architectures that address business needs and strategic direction.
Works on the design and implementation of technical solutions to meet specific business needs.
Understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Create technical documentation related to Infrastructure Architecture, including automation, governance, and building reliability.
Build prototype models of solutions to validate concepts and approaches.
Provide strategic recommendations and guidance on both business and technological initiatives.
Identify and select appropriate technologies to achieve desired outcomes.
Develop strategies and implement tools to optimize communication and collaboration with internal clients, ensuring clarity and efficiency.
Investigate the best solution (cSuite, AppSpace, Simpplr) for communication and exchange with the Business.
Regularly engage with internal colleagues to support definition and validation processes.
Act as the primary liaison with external implementation partners, ensuring clear communication and alignment throughout the project lifecycle.
Oversee and execute testing activities, ensuring the quality and accuracy of solutions before validation and deployment.
Define flexible and generic business processes for managing reference data.
Analyze and manage integrations with external systems, ensuring seamless connectivity and functionality.
Identify potential technical risks, challenges, and dependencies early in the project.
Develop mitigation strategies to minimize these risks and ensure project success.
Design solutions that adhere to industry standards, regulatory requirements, security best practices, and non-functional requirements like scalability, availability, and maintainability.
Documentation and Transition
Own the Solution Architecture Document starting from version 2.1 onwards.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Deep understanding of various technologies, including software, hardware, and network systems.
Knowledge of different architectural patterns and frameworks (e.g., microservices, SOA, event-driven architecture).
Expertise in cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Understanding of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL).
Knowledge of integration patterns and technologies (APIs, messaging queues).
Familiarity with DevOps principles and practices.
Strong understanding of security principles and best practices.
Ability to analyze complex business requirements and technical challenges.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities to design effective and efficient solutions.
Keen attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to diverse audiences (both technical and non-technical).
Strong presentation and negotiation skills.
Ability to build relationships and collaborate effectively with various stakeholders.
Ability to provide technical leadership and mentorship to development teams.
Project management skills, including planning, organization, and risk management.
Ability to influence and guide decision-making.
Understanding of business processes and objectives.
Ability to align technical solutions with business goals and strategy.
Understanding of financial aspects like cost estimation and ROI.
Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing environments.
Proactive in staying updated with industry trends and advancements.
Solution Architecture Document (SAD): Owner starting from version 2.1 onwards.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Learns to establish a positive rapport with the client(s) to develop and maintain long-term relationships, to understand the client's business, their objectives and expectations, and to gain experience in acting as go-to person on all aspects of services and support for assigned relationships.
Assists in the evaluation process of the client's business requirements, effort estimation, and guiding the client to utilize standard solutions while maximizing revenue. Supports higher level analysts on sub-components of major initiatives.
Participates in converting the client's business requirements into detailed technical specifications and learns how to present them internally and externally while securing requirement sign-off.
Gains and maintains knowledge of how to identify critical business impact issues from Service Desk.
Assists with documents and maintenance to the clients' system environments by keeping records of client functionality, environment, and client specific documentation while providing to more senior levels for review and feedback.
Participates in release management between Service Desk, Compliance and Project as well as client activities such as Payment Card Industry audits and internal projects, ensuring that code release doesn't negatively impact client operations.
Takes part in execution of simple project/development work plans and learns to revise them as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.
Occasionally acts as 24x7 first line Service Desk support, as requested, and monitors adherence to Service Desk SLAs (Service Level Agreements).
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Bachelor's Degree - in Information Technology or related field
Typically Minimum 1-2 Years Relevant Exp
Experience in analysis, issue resolution, problem solving, detail oriented, as well as the ability to troubleshoot errors with clients
Experience working with APIs and supporting real time communications
Ability to take technical information and make it business friendly
Required on-call support for issues (on a rotating schedule)
Excellent communication skills
Skills / Knowledge - Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.
Job Complexity - Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships.
Supervision - Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments.
Bankcard Business Knowledge - Extends knowledge of bankcard business requirements and process flows
Language Skills - Advanced knowledge of English, written and verbal (C1 - C2) and Intermediate knowledge of Polish, written and verbal (B1-B2)
Optional
Including experience in financial services software and solutions programming, installation, certification, issue resolution, business, requirements gathering, technical design, technical presentation, experience in writing and analyzing
Prime Licensing code a plus
IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification a plus
Basic Programming and analysis of financial services software a plus
Programming - Good database development skills in Oracle PL/SQL a plus
Good programming skills in C, C++, ANSI C or VB.NET, ASP.NET and Microsoft Visual Studio a plus
Knowledge of UNIX/Linux Operating Systems a plus
Experience with using Postman or other API platform UI tools a plus
Credit card knowledge and experience a plus

description_block:
VISA
Scroll to company's profile
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
Visa‚Äôs Technology Organization is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world‚Äôs most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you‚Äôll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

When we say, ‚Äúthe stuff dreams are made of,‚Äù we‚Äôre not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. offered_section:
What we offer
Let's be healthy ‚Äì medical package, sports card, and numerous sports sections ‚Äì these are some of the beneÔ¨Åts that help our employees stay in good shape.
Let's be balanced ‚Äì work-life balance is a key aspect of a healthy workplace. We offer our employees flexible working hours, a confidential employee assistant program, as well as the possibility of remote working. However, staying at home with our in-office gaming room and dog-friendly office in Warsaw won‚Äôt be easy.
Let's be smart ‚Äì we organize numerous workshops and training courses. Thanks to hackathons and meetups, our specialists share their expertise with others. Additionally, we have a wide range of digital learning platforms and language courses.
Let's be responsible ‚Äì each year, we participate in several CSR activities, during which, together with our colleagues, we do our best to create a better future.
Let's be fun ‚Äì company-wide bike races and soccer matches, Ô¨Ålm marathons in our cinema room or other engaging team-building activities ‚Äì we got it covered!
Let's be diverse ‚Äì every team member is valued, regardless of gender, nationality, religious beliefs, disability, age, and sexual orientation or identity. Your qualiÔ¨Åcations, experience, and mindset are our greatest beneÔ¨Åt!
description_block:
ERGO Technology & Services S.A.
Scroll to company's profile
ERGO Technology & Services S.A. (ET&S S.A.) was established in January 2021 following the integration of ERGO Digital IT and Atena into one entity, leveraging both companies' strengths and best practices. As a part of ERGO Technology & Services Management AG, the technology holding of ERGO Group AG, we support millions of internal and external customers with state-of-the-art IT solutions to everyday problems.
In October 2022, ET&S S.A. expanded its scope of operations by creating a Business Services unit to contribute in a new way to the growth of ERGO's business. Acting as a co-partner and internal consultant, it adds non-IT value and supports the development of the entire ERGO Group, currently offering skills in reporting, analysis, actuarial, and input management. We are committed to fostering innovation and meeting the evolving needs of our clients worldwide.
Discover how we implement AI, IoT, Voice Recognition, Big Data science, advanced mobile solutions, and business-related services to anticipate and address our customers' future needs.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Provide first and second-level IT support for multiple customers via mail, chat and calls.
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve hardware, software, and network issues.
Escalate complex issues to higher-level support teams as needed.
Log, track, and manage tickets in the IT Service Management (ITSM) tool.
Ensure SLAs and response times are met for incident resolution and service requests.
Maintain accurate documentation of issues and resolutions.
Act as the first point of contact for end-users via phone, email, or chat.
Provide clear and professional communication to users regarding issue status and resolution.
Educate customers on best practices and self-service solutions where applicable.
Support IT infrastructure, applications, and enterprise systems.
Perform user account management (Active Directory, email, access controls).
Assist in software installations, updates, and security patches.
Identify recurring issues and suggest improvements to reduce incidents.
Contribute to knowledge base articles and troubleshooting guides.
Support IT policies, compliance, and security best practices.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
6 months - 2 years of experience in a service desk or technical support role.
German on at least B2 level
English on at least B2 level
Strong troubleshooting skills in Windows, macOS, and Linux environments.
Knowledge of networking fundamentals (DNS, DHCP, VPN, TCP/IP).
Experience with Active Directory, Office 365, and remote desktop tools.
Familiarity with ITIL framework and ITSM tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira, Remedy).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong customer service orientation and problem-solving mindset.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.
Optional
French, Spanish, German, Dutch or Polish is nice to have as an additional language.
IT certifications (CompTIA A+, ITIL Foundation, Microsoft, Cisco).
Experience working in a managed services or shared services environment.
Familiarity with automation tools and scripting (PowerShell, Bash).

offered_section:
What we offer
At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspire innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. We‚Äôre emphasizing a culture of togetherness ‚Äì one that builds community, prioritizes collaboration and continuous improvement.
The philosophy is fundamental to living our company‚Äôs values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at Emerson.
Moreover, our global volunteer employee resource groups will empower you to connect with peers that share the same interest, promote diversity and inclusion and positively contribute to communities around us.
We understand the importance of work-life balance and are dedicated to supporting our employees' personal and professional needs. From competitive benefits plans and comprehensive medical care to equitable opportunities for growth and development we strive to create a workplace that is supportive and rewarding. Our work schedule aims at creating new levels of growth, build a stronger community and provide greater professional development for our employees.
description_block:
Emerson Process Management Sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
At Emerson, we prioritize a workplace where every employee is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We foster an environment that encourages innovation, collaboration, and diverse perspectives‚Äîbecause we know that great ideas come from great teams. Our dedication to ongoing career development and growing an inclusive culture ensures you have the support to thrive. Whether through mentorship, training, or leadership opportunities, we invest in your success so you can make a lasting impact. We believe diverse teams, working together are key to driving growth and delivering business results.
additional_module_section:
Who You Are:
You are a curious, collaborative, and technically adept professional who thrives in an agile environment. You understand embedded systems and are passionate about delivering meaningful value to users. You balance critical thinking with a hands-on approach and consistently bring a customer-first attitude to your work. You're a great teammate who enjoys collaborating across different areas and regions, always seeking opportunities to improve.

3. You meet our recruiter online for an introductory interview.
4. You meet your future team members for an interview so you can demonstrate your skills.
5. You receive a job offer. Welcome aboard!

LeverX

LeverX is an international company and a global system integrator that combines two teams ‚Äî LeverX and Emerline.
LeverX specializes in SAP implementation and customization. For over 20 years, it has been sustaining a reliable and reputable partnership with SAP. As an SAP Gold Partner and Global Strategic Supplier, the company helps companies leverage investments in SAP solutions.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities

Solid experience in SAP ArchiveLink, DVS-KPro, S/4HANA, Fiori and HDM.

Experience in SAP customizing, ABAP development, and transport management.
Strong analytical thinking and solution-oriented approach to problem solving.
Excellent coordination and communication skills across technical and business teams.
Ability to conceptualize solutions within complex IT and process architectures.
Comfortable working in virtual, distributed international teams.
Fluent English language skills, both written and spoken.
Structured and methodical approach to requirements analysis and solution design.
Optional
Experience in large-scale S/4HANA transition or archiving strategy projects.
Knowledge of regulatory and compliance aspects in archiving.
Knowledge in data archiving.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Provision and automate new AWS environments using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform.
Deploy and manage Kafka clusters, ensuring high availability and security with TLS/SSL mutual authentication and encryption.
Implement Kafka MirrorMaker for data replication and synchronization across multiple data centers.
Manage and maintain AWS services, including EC2, EKS, ECR, S3, KMS, VPC, SageMaker, and CloudWatch.
Configure networking components within AWS, including VPCs, security groups, subnets, and transit gateways.
Develop, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines using ArgoCD and Jenkins for automated deployments.
Utilize Kubernetes (EKS) for container orchestration and implement Istio service mesh for secure service-to-service communication.
Implement monitoring and logging using AWS CloudWatch, Datadog, and other alerting frameworks.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
AWS Services: EC2, EKS, ECR, S3, KMS, VPC, SageMaker, CloudWatch
Networking: AWS VPC, Security Groups, Subnets, Transit Gateways

CI/CD & Automation: ArgoCD, Jenkins for deployment automation

Optional
Experience with service mesh solutions (e.g., Istio) for secure service-to-service communication
Knowledge of perimeter security auditing and external authorization filters (e.g., Istio External Authorization Filter)
Hands-on experience with fine-grained access control and AuthZ services for least privilege enforcement
Background in logging and auditing for compliance and security purposes
Familiarity with managing external service integrations in a secure and audited manner

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Design and implement audio systems and tools to support dynamic and immersive soundscapes.
Integrate sound effects, music, and voiceovers into the game using industry-standard audio middleware.
Collaborate with sound designers and composers to ensure seamless audio implementation.
Develop and optimize audio pipelines for real-time performance on multiple platforms.
Implement spatial audio systems, including 3D audio and ambisonics for realistic sound positioning.
Work closely with gameplay programmers to synchronize audio with game mechanics and events.
Debug and resolve audio-related issues, ensuring compatibility and performance.
Maintain and update technical documentation for audio systems and tools.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Proficiency in C++ and/or C#, with experience in audio programming.
Experience with audio middleware such as FMOD or Wwise.
Knowledge of real-time audio systems, including spatial audio and dynamic sound design.
Familiarity with game engines like Unity or Unreal Engine for audio integration.
Understanding of DSP (Digital Signal Processing) techniques and audio optimization.
Experience with cross-platform audio development for PC, consoles, and mobile devices.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex audio issues.
Optional
Experience with procedural audio generation and synthesis.
Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python or Lua for tool development.
Knowledge of audio file formats, compression techniques, and streaming audio.
Experience with machine learning in audio processing or sound classification.
Exposure to AR/VR audio systems, including head-related transfer function (HRTF) modeling.
Understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies.

responsibilities_section:

Document system configurations, processes, and best practices.

responsibilities_section:

benefit_titles: ['remote work opportunities']
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Configure, administer, and maintain the ITSM platform (e.g., ServiceNow, BMC Remedy, Cherwell, or similar).
Design and implement ITIL-based workflows for incident, problem, change, and service request management.
Develop and maintain custom reports and dashboards for performance monitoring and decision-making.
Collaborate with IT and business teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical configurations.
Perform system upgrades, patches, and regular maintenance to ensure platform reliability and security.
Integrate the ITSM platform with other IT systems and tools (e.g., monitoring systems, CMDB).
Ensure data accuracy and maintain the Configuration Management Database (CMDB).
Document ITSM processes, configurations, and best practices.
Provide user training and support to enhance adoption and effective use of the ITSM platform.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
3+ years of experience in administering ITSM tools such as ServiceNow, BMC Remedy, or similar platforms.
Strong understanding of ITIL processes and service management best practices.
Proficiency in workflow design, automation, and customization of ITSM platforms.
Experience with scripting languages such as JavaScript, PowerShell, or Python for automation.
Familiarity with reporting and dashboard creation using built-in tools or third-party solutions.
Knowledge of integration methods using APIs and web services.
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for working with diverse teams.
Optional
ITIL Certification (e.g., ITIL Foundation or higher).
Experience with ITSM platform migration or implementation projects.
Knowledge of DevOps and Agile practices.
Familiarity with monitoring tools like Nagios, Zabbix, or Prometheus.
Exposure to cloud-based ITSM solutions and their deployment.
Experience with performance optimization of ITSM workflows and systems.

benefit_titles: ['remote work opportunities']
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Install, configure, and maintain SAP systems such as SAP S/4HANA, ECC, BW, or Fiori.
Monitor and optimize the performance of SAP applications, databases, and servers.
Manage SAP system upgrades, patches, and support package applications.
Perform user administration, including role management and access control within SAP Basis.
Implement and maintain backup and recovery strategies for SAP systems.
Troubleshoot and resolve SAP system issues, including system crashes, performance bottlenecks, and connectivity problems.
Collaborate with functional and technical teams to ensure seamless integration of SAP modules.
Maintain and monitor SAP transport management system (TMS).
Document SAP system configurations, processes, and best practices.
Ensure compliance with security policies and manage audit requirements for SAP environments.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
3+ years of experience in SAP system administration.
Proficiency in SAP Basis administration, including system installation, upgrades, and performance tuning.
Hands-on experience with HANA or Oracle databases for SAP environments.
Strong understanding of SAP NetWeaver architecture.
Knowledge of transport management and change management in SAP.
Familiarity with SAP security concepts, including roles and authorizations.
Experience with monitoring tools like SAP Solution Manager or third-party alternatives.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex SAP issues.
Optional
Experience with SAP cloud solutions like SAP Cloud Platform or SAP BTP.
Knowledge of Linux or Windows system administration for SAP.
Experience in SAP migrations (e.g., ECC to S/4HANA).
Familiarity with SAP Fiori or SAP Gateway configuration.
Exposure to DevOps practices and automation tools like Ansible or Terraform.
Certification in SAP administration (e.g., SAP Certified Technology Associate ‚Äì System Administration).

description_block:
Vistra Poland
Scroll to company's profile
At Vistra our purpose is progress. We believe that our clients have the power to change the world and to do great things for global progress, and we exist to remove the friction that comes from the complexity of global business ‚Äì to help our clients achieve progress without friction.
But progress only happens when people come together and take action. And we‚Äôre absolutely committed to building a culture where our people can do just that.
It‚Äôs never been a more exciting time to join our organisation with over 9000 colleagues in 50+ jurisdictions across the globe. We‚Äôre seizing the opportunity to create a purpose-led organisation that will unlock significant value for our business, our clients, and our people.

Design, deploy, and manage OpenStack environments for private and hybrid cloud infrastructures.

Troubleshoot and resolve OpenStack-related issues, ensuring high availability and reliability.

3+ years of hands-on experience with OpenStack deployment and management.

Experience with networking protocols and technologies (e.g., VLAN, VXLAN, SDN).
Knowledge of storage systems and configurations (Ceph, NFS, or iSCSI).
Familiarity with scripting and automation using tools like Bash, Python, or Ansible.

This role offers the opportunity to work on cutting-edge cloud technologies and support critical infrastructure initiatives. If you are passionate about OpenStack and cloud engineering, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Design and develop complex process orchestration solutions using BPMN on the Camunda 7/8 platform.
Implement decision logic using DMN, configure decision tables, and DRDs.
Write, review, and maintain code (JSON, Feel, Go) for process configuration, ensuring it meets business requirements and best practices.
Sole complex process challenges through innovative technical solutions and optimization techniques.
Optimize process performance by analyzing and improving data flow and system integration.
Develop, manage, and maintain user task forms using embedded or external forms.
Configure and integrate processes with internal and external applications using Camunda APIs.
Create and maintain custom connectors and job workers using Camunda SDKs.
Conduct rules analysis and develop decision services, ensuring adherence to best practices and standards.
Perform unit testing and debugging to ensure process reliability and efficiency.
Deploy Camunda BPM applications across various environments, ensuring minimal downtime and seamless transitions.
Monitor and optimize Camunda BPM processes for performance and scalability.
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues encountered during development and deployment.
Develop extensions and integrations using Camunda SDKs, APIs, and official clients.
Manage and document system configurations, procedures, and best practices.
Create, manage, and maintain documentation.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Education - Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Min. Professional Requirements
At least 1 year of hands-on experience in developing process orchestration solutions using BPMN and DMN standards, with a strong focus on Camunda8 platform.
Experience in software development, particularly in coding, debugging, and optimization.
Proven experience in solving complex technical challenges and optimizing process performance.
Proficient understanding of JSON structure, FEEL expressions, Go.
Familiar with software development techniques such as Unit Testing and Refactoring.
Competencies/Experience
Proficient in high-level programming languages such as Java, Go, or similar. Strong understanding of JSON structures, FEEL expressions, and REST APIs. Good understanding of documentation standards and practices. Understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including Analysis, Design, Development, Testing, and Deployment. Familiarity with Agile methodologies, including DevOps and Scrum. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and teamwork abilities. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines. Commitment to continuous learning and professional development. Camunda certification (e.g., Camunda Certified Professional - Developer) is highly desirable.
Languages - English: min. Advanced
Optional
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Commitment to continuous learning and professional development.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Learns to establish a positive rapport with the client(s) to develop and maintain long-term relationships, to understand the client's business, their objectives and expectations, and to gain experience in acting as go-to person on all aspects of services and support for assigned relationships.
Assists in the evaluation process of the client's business requirements, effort estimation, and guiding the client to utilize standard solutions while maximizing revenue. Supports higher level analysts on sub-components of major initiatives.
Participates in converting the client's business requirements into detailed technical specifications and learns how to present them internally and externally while securing requirement sign-off.
Gains and maintains knowledge of how to identify critical business impact issues from Service Desk.
Assists with documents and maintenance to the clients' system environments by keeping records of client functionality, environment, and client specific documentation while providing to more senior levels for review and feedback.
Participates in release management between Service Desk, Compliance and Project as well as client activities such as Payment Card Industry audits and internal projects, ensuring that code release doesn't negatively impact client operations.
Takes part in execution of simple project/development work plans and learns to revise them as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.
Occasionally acts as 24x7 first line Service Desk support, as requested, and monitors adherence to Service Desk SLAs (Service Level Agreements).
Working schedule would coincide with US hours to start 2:00pm - 10:00pm CET= 8:00am - 4:00 pm EST

Bachelor's Degree - in Information Technology or related field

Experience working with APIs and supporting real time communications
Ability to take technical information and make it business friendly
Required on-call support for issues (on a rotating schedule)
Experience with using Postman or other API platform UI tools
Excellent communication skills
Skills / Knowledge - Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.
Job Complexity - Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships.
Supervision - Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments.
Bankcard Business Knowledge - knowledge of bankcard business requirements and process flows
Knowledge of UNIX/Linux Operating Systems
Language Skills - Advanced knowledge of English, written and verbal (C1 - C2) and intermediate knowledge of Polish (B1-B2)
Optional
Including experience in financial services software and solutions programming, installation, certification, issue resolution, business, requirements gathering, technical design, technical presentation, experience in writing and analyzing
Basic Programming and analysis of financial services software
Credit card knowledge and experience
Prime Licensing code
IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification
Programming - Good database development skills in Oracle PL/SQL
Good programming skills in C, C++, ANSI C or VB.NET, ASP.NET and Microsoft Visual Studio

working in a global environment with international market-focused projects

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Define & Own Enterprise level Data Architecture Target picture:
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain the enterprise data target picture, ensuring alignment with business goals and regulatory requirements.
‚Ä¢ Drive the adoption of Data Vault best practices to enable a modern, scalable data ecosystem.
Enterprise-Wide Data Governance & Standardization:
‚Ä¢ Establish data architecture principles, support the governance frameworks, and enforce best practices across the organization.
‚Ä¢ Establish and enforce the design patterns driven by data security, privacy regulations and compliance.
Solution Design & Implementation:
‚Ä¢ Together with Data platform domain architect, lead the design and integration of data platforms, pipelines, and storage solutions.
‚Ä¢ Together with business domain architects, lead the master data, reference data, and metadata design across the data ecosystem.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure efficient data ingestion, transformation, and analytics solutions.
Stakeholder Collaboration & Leadership:
‚Ä¢ Partner with business leaders, data engineers, and data scientists/analysts to align data architecture with business objectives.
‚Ä¢ Act as a trusted advisor for data-related decisions, balancing performance, cost, and compliance considerations.
‚Ä¢ Drive cross-functional adoption of data-driven culture and architecture best practices.
Technology Evaluation & Innovation:
‚Ä¢ Evaluate emerging data technologies, architectures, and methodologies to ensure continuous innovation.
‚Ä¢ Recommend improvements and optimizations for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Proven experience (7+ years) in data architecture, preferably within financial services or banking IT environments.
Strong expertise in Azure Cloud data services (e.g., Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse, Azure Databricks).
Experience with Data Vault 2.0 modelling for scalable, auditable data warehousing.
Strong understanding of data governance, security, and regulatory compliance in financial services.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, or Spark for data processing and architecture solutions.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to bridge technical and business needs.
Experience in leading and influencing enterprise-wide data strategy and implementation.
Optional
Certifications in Azure Data Architecture (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert).
Experience with event-driven and real-time data architectures.
Knowledge of machine learning and AI-driven analytics in financial services.

BEC is a financial technology company creating IT solutions for Danish banks. Together, we enable their customers to invest online, take out loans and transfer money. In other words, everything it takes to run a bank.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Contribute to the platform roadmap together with cloud architects and derive technical requirements for new capabilities across data, analytics, and AI services.
Plan, design, and implement features and services on Azure Cloud and Databricks in line with non-functional requirements like security, scalability, and cost efficiency.
Provide training and documentation to internal users and stakeholders to support adoption of new features.
Maintain and improve platform operations, including lifecycle management, incident handling, service requests, and automation.
Monitor platform compliance and drive improvements using data-driven and AI-based methods.
Collaborate with cloud, infrastructure, and security teams to ensure alignment with best practices and internal standards.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
3‚Äì5 years of hands-on experience in Azure Cloud development, with a strong understanding of IaC (Terraform, Bicep, ARM).
Solid knowledge of Data & AI stack: Databricks, Azure ML, Azure Data Factory.
Strong grasp of Azure networking and authentication (e.g., Private Link, Azure Firewall, VPC setup, Entra ID).
Experience with CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions), infrastructure-as-code, and automation best practices.
Familiarity with data modeling, warehousing, and cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake).
Strong communication, documentation, and consulting skills.
Fluent in English.
offered_section:
What we offer
Hybrid work model ‚Äì 1 day per week in the Warsaw office
Salary: negotiable, based on individual qualifications
Employment type: full-time employment contract
Access to an attractive benefits package (private medical care including dental and mental health, bonus and reward program, co-financed FitProfit sport card, holiday allowance, life and travel insurance, additional paid days off, budget for home office setup, subsidized meals in the office, modern office with game room and relaxation area)

description_block:
Maxima Europe Sp. z.o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Global challenges and evolving customer demands call for global talent strategies and international teams. This is why all major companies and many SMEs work with IT outsourcing and consultancy partners such as Maxima Consulting. Our technology consultants utilize their knowledge and skills to become trusted advisors to clients in multiple industries. They deliver cutting-edge solutions tailored to client‚Äôs individual business needs, support and coach their in-house IT teams, and champion innovation.
Maxima Consulting is proud to be a people-centric organization where all employees are valued and recognized as a leading company strength. We are a team of long-term thinkers focused on sustainability and growth and have a track record of long-lasting partnerships with our clients and consultants alike. You are welcome here regardless of your gender, religion, location, age, and any other personal characteristics.
additional_module_section:
Recruitment process flow
We respect your time and effort, so our recruitment process is as short and convenient as possible. Our recruiters are committed to keeping you in the loop and will happily answer your questions to help you prepare or clarify our expectations.
1. You apply for a job.
2. We review your profile to ensure you‚Äôre going for an opening that suits you best.
3. You meet our recruiter online for an introductory interview.
4. You meet your future team members for an interview so you can demonstrate your skills.
5. You receive a job offer. Welcome aboard!

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Role overview:
We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will leverage advanced analytical techniques and machine learning models to extract actionable insights from our complex data sets, driving strategic decision-making and operational excellence. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to develop innovative solutions that enhance our logistics operations, improve efficiency, and elevate the customer experience.
Key responsibilities:
- Partner with our product and business teams to understand their needs, translate them into data science solutions, and provide actionable insights
- Develop and implement advanced data science solutions (including ML models, AI products, optimization frameworks etc.)
- Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of data-driven initiatives
- Stay ahead of the curve exploring cutting-edge methods and being on top of new trends in Data Science & AI
- Communicate insights and recommendations to the management and business teams, and other data community members
requirements_section:
Our requirements
General requirements:
- Education ‚Äì Bachelor‚Äôs, Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in a relevant field, e.g. data science, computer science, mathematics, statistics, econometrics, physics or similar
- Experience ‚Äì at least 3 years of experience working using data science methods. Strong technical and/or research background is a plus.
- Mindset ‚Äì you are data-driven, goal-oriented and proactive, skilled in change and time management, business-conscious, able to think long-term and decompose business problems
- Languages ‚Äì you are proficient in English and Polish (other languages knowledge is a plus)
Nice to have:
- Experience applying data science methods at scale or building models used in production by large number of users
- Previous work on open-source projects
- Experience in working in a data-driven environment, designing, executing and analysing many experiments
- Specialized knowledge in some of these areas: logistics, operation research, forecasting, spatial data science, graph methods, product analytics or marketing data science
Technical requirements:
- Excellent knowledge of ML solutions and their impact on business, user experience and operational processes (supervised and unsupervised learning, e.g.: clustering, recommender systems, regression, classification, linear programming, reinforcement learning, time series, geospatial analysis, etc.
- Hands-on experience with working with large amounts of data
- Proficiency in Python 3, as well as ML and data analysis libraries (e.g. pandas, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, statsmodels, tf/pytorch, etc.)
- Experience in writing well-structured code: functions, classes, modules.
- Knowledge and experience in PySpark, relational databases, cloud solutions (e.g. Databricks, Azure, GCP, AWS, Snowflake)
Nice to have:
- Proficiency in testing code
- Knowledge of best practices regarding writing readable code, technical reviews and maintainability
- Knowledge of ML Ops and experience with data pipelines framework, preferably Kedro
- Experience of creating ML models used in production, knowledge of SRE principles
- Experience with CLI tools: bash/zsh
- Experience in leveraging CI/CD pipelines in data-based products
offered_section:
What we offer
An interesting job in one of the most dynamically growing companies in Poland ‚Äì a leader in offering modern logistics services
Development and implementation of projects with a global reach
Subsidies for benefits (medical care, Multisport card, life insurance)
Flexible working hours
An informal atmosphere and a cohesive team
Competition and fun at joint events, including sports events like Runmageddon and Poland Business Run.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
We are seeking a skilled and innovative AI Engineer with Full Stack Development expertise who has experience working with Generative AI (GenAI) models, such as Large Language Models (LLMs), and implementing these solutions into web applications. This role combines the responsibilities of a full-stack developer with advanced knowledge of machine learning models, APIs, and cloud infrastructure, focusing on integrating state-of-the-art AI capabilities into user-friendly and efficient web-based applications.
Key Responsibilities:
Model Integration & API Development:
Integrate LLMs and other GenAI models into web applications through efficient API design and implementation.
Build and optimize API endpoints to allow seamless, real-time interaction between front-end applications and back-end AI models.
Design and develop secure, scalable, and high-performing microservices for AI model deployment.
Front-End Development:
Design and develop responsive and intuitive front-end applications using React.js to enhance the user experience of AI-powered applications.
Implement front-end components to visualize, interpret, and manage AI model outputs effectively.
Back-End Development & AI Pipelines:
Develop robust back-end systems in Python to support the deployment, scalability, and maintenance of GenAI models.
Build and maintain data pipelines, including preprocessing data and post-processing AI model outputs for consumption by applications.
Implement best practices for handling sensitive data and maintaining model performance.
Infrastructure & Deployment:
Use Kubernetes and Docker for containerization and orchestration to ensure scalable deployment and management of AI applications.
Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automated testing and deployment of code changes.
Maintain a scalable and secure cloud infrastructure, leveraging platforms such as Google Cloud Platform, or Azure for model training, storage, and deployment.
LLM and GenAI Ecosystem Expertise:
Utilize vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, or Faiss) to manage and retrieve embeddings for efficient similarity search and recommendation systems.
Work with frameworks for model development and deployment, including Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain, and OpenAI.
Optimize and fine-tune LLMs to improve performance based on application needs.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Required Qualifications:
- Min Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
- 3+ years of experience as a full-stack developer, ideally with a focus on AI model integration.
- Proficiency in Python for backend development and React.js for frontend development.
- Strong knowledge of GenAI models and LLMs, including experience with model selection, tuning, and embedding strategies.
- Experience with API development and integration to facilitate communication between front-end applications and AI models.
- Working knowledge of containerization technologies like Docker and container orchestration with Kubernetes.
- Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) for AI model deployment and scalability.
- Proficient in vector databases and their integration with LLM models for enhanced application functionality.
- Familiarity with database management (SQL, NoSQL) and caching solutions (e.g., Redis).
- Experience in CI/CD pipelines, code versioning (Git), and DevOps practices.
- Excellent knowledge of English AND Polish.
Soft Skills:
- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
- Excellent communication skills to translate technical requirements into actionable development tasks.
- Proactive approach to staying updated with emerging AI technologies and frameworks.
This is a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI applications that leverage the latest advancements in Generative AI and Large Language Models, impacting the future of intelligent software development.
Optional
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of streaming architectures for real-time data processing and ingestion (e.g., Apache Kafka).
Familiarity with serverless architectures (e.g., AWS Lambda) for scalable deployment of AI features.
Prior experience in ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or ONNX.
Understanding of data privacy and security best practices in AI applications.

The key industries include manufacturing, automotive, telecommunications, healthcare, transportation, retail, financial services, etc.

description_block:
VISA
Scroll to company's profile
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
Visa‚Äôs Technology Organization is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world‚Äôs most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you‚Äôll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
additional_module_section:
**We do not expect that any single candidate would fulfill all of these characteristics. For instance, we have strong team members who are really focused on building scalable systems but didn‚Äôt work with payments technology before joining Visa.
This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site).

description_block:
VISA
Scroll to company's profile
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
Visa‚Äôs Technology Organization is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world‚Äôs most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you‚Äôll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.

We respect your time and effort, so our recruitment process is as short and convenient as possible. Our recruiters are committed to keeping you in the loop and will happily answer your questions to help you prepare or clarify our expectations.
