employer_name: BNP Paribas S.A. Branch PolandAbout the company
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
CIB ITO Tech Graduate Program in Poland ‚Äì Graduate IT Business Analyst (September 2025)
The CIB ITO Tech Graduate Program in a few words: Imagine joining a permanent contract in an 18-month #excellence #pathway, designed as a true accelerator of personal and professional development, within the expert teams of CIB ITO of the BNP PARIBAS Group. It is designed to offer you high-level training and rapid autonomy. The Tech Graduate Program is the path of excellence to launch your career as an IT Business Analyst.
Are you ready to take on the technological challenges of Corporate Banking in an international environment?
What will your daily life look like?
‚Ä¢ You will start with an 18-month journey within the same department, including different assignments and scrum teams.
‚Ä¢ To enhance your skills and quickly acquire the keys to professional development, mentoring is at the heart of the Tech Graduate Program at CIB ITO. From the beginning of the program, each Graduate will meet their Mentor & Buddy: an experienced and highly skilled IT Business Analyst with whom you will regularly exchange on your on-the-job training, your questions, and at the same time, can help you build a solid social network within the BNP Paribas Group. We know that sharing knowledge is crucial for learning and advancing in your career.
‚Ä¢ Finally, continuous training is a part of the DNA of this Graduate Program: you will benefit from a wide range of training on hard skills and soft skills, as well as IT forums and round tables to prepare you to meet the challenges of the Bank of tomorrow.
Responsibilities:
Graduate IT Business Analysts understand and analyze business needs, with the aim of developing applications. They ensure that the solution meets the functional and technical requirements. They act as the contact person, and they bridge the gap between IT and the business.
Main activities:
‚Ä¢ You will contribute to preliminary studies in liaison with the business line.
‚Ä¢ You will formalize the need and ensure it is approved by the business line.
‚Ä¢ You will clarify, perform critical and constructive analysis of the business line‚Äôs needs.
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll define and obtain approval of the requirements set out to cover the needs
‚Ä¢ You will cooperate with developers to help them understand business needs.
‚Ä¢ You will support the business line in carrying out user tests.
‚Ä¢ You will contribute, in conjunction with the business line, to change management and roll out for the end customer.
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll help to identify business line impacts generated by the solution and with the development of action plans.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Are you our next Graduate IT Business Analyst?
The Graduate Program is looking for the following profile:
‚Ä¢ People who graduated less than 2 years ago and have up to 24 months of professional experience (excluding internships, apprenticeships) from the date of graduation.
‚Ä¢ Bac+ degree from an engineering school or equivalent university with an IT specialization.
‚Ä¢ Passionate about new technologies.
‚Ä¢ Willingness and ability to work with local and remote multicultural teams.
‚Ä¢ Interest in corporate finance.
In terms of technical skills, you‚Äôre the person we‚Äôre looking for if:
‚Ä¢ You have a great understanding of Agile practices and Scrum methodology and IT Business Analyst role
‚Ä¢ You have good costumer relationship as well as costumer journey approach.
‚Ä¢ You have a basic understanding of Architecture and Data Knowledge.
‚Ä¢ You have a good understanding of IT tests.
‚Ä¢ You may have basic knowledge on Finance, Accounting and Banks areas.
Regarding soft skills, we‚Äôre looking for you if:
‚Ä¢ You speak fluent English.
‚Ä¢ You have strong analytical and interpersonal skills and demonstrate a good team spirit.
‚Ä¢ You are focused on your client‚Äôs satisfaction and in delivering results.
‚Ä¢ You are able to share knowledge, while being able to synthesize information.
‚Ä¢ You demonstrated ability to manage projects and adapt processes.
‚Ä¢ You have strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
offered_section:
What we offer
Why join BNP Paribas?
Our world is changing: the way we get information, consume... and work too! Today, what matters in a job is to have real experiences, to learn, to share goals and results with colleagues. In short, to chart your own path, different, responsible, and sustainable. At BNP Paribas, we recruit our employees with the idea that they will help us design the world and the bank of tomorrow.
Don't hesitate any longer and join us!
Finally, we attach particular importance to our future employees acting daily with ethical and professional responsibility. In a changing world, diversity, equity, and inclusion are key values for the well-being and performance of teams. At BNP Paribas, we want to welcome and retain all talents without distinction: this is how we will build, together, the finance of tomorrow, innovative, responsible, and sustainable. At any time during the recruitment process, the information on your CV and your identification data may be verified by an external service provider mandated by BNP Paribas.
Program start date: September 2025
description_block:
BNP Paribas S.A. Branch Poland
Scroll to company's profile
We are BNP Paribas S.A. (Branch in Poland), a part of BNP Paribas Group with 200 years of experience in banking. Since 2008, we are at the heart of Warsaw, and now we are also in a brand-new location in Krakow. As Corporate and Institutional Banking (CIB), we offer financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients in a number of locations globally.
Our Securities Services business line is a multi-asset servicing specialist. We are an exciting, dynamic, and growing operations centre; therefore, we are looking for candidates who are willing to be a vital part of the expansion of BNP Paribas‚Äô operational scope in Poland.
It‚Äôs our values that drive us forward and are a cornerstone of our business. We rely on our strengths, which include stability, responsibility, expertise, and being a good place to work.
additional_module_section:
How to join the program?
It‚Äôs very simple ‚Äì just send us your CV!
1. You will receive an invitation to take an online test. If selected, the recruiter will contact you for a short screening call.
2. Next, expect an HR interview with the recruiter.
3. Finally, you will participate in a technical interview with one or more Managers.
If the fit is mutual, you are a Graduate!

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Take full ownership of the internal IT environment ‚Äì from infrastructure and systems to daily user support.
Administer and manage the Microsoft 365 environment ‚Äì including users, groups, licensing, Teams, Exchange Online (emails), SharePoint access, and Office applications.
Support the process of obtaining and managing ISO 27001 certification for the company, including preparation, application, and compliance oversight.
Oversee system integration across departments ‚Äì analyze how existing systems operate, propose improvements, and implement necessary changes.
Manage the full lifecycle of IT equipment and software ‚Äì including hardware/software setup, device provisioning, and license management
Design and maintain internal IT security policies and best practices, including access control, device management, and data protection.
Act as the first point of contact for employees regarding IT issues ‚Äì troubleshoot and resolve hardware/software problems in a timely and efficient manner.
Occasionally support out-of-hours incidents or escalations (on-call in exceptional cases only).
Collaborate with international teams.
Contribute to internal IT strategy and improvement initiatives, especially around automation and standardization of workflows.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Minimum 3‚Äì4 years of experience in IT administration, IT operations, or infrastructure role.
Strong, hands-on experience managing Microsoft 365, including Azure AD, Exchange Online, Teams, SharePoint, and Intune.
Solid understanding of networking, system administration, and IT best practices.
Understanding of IT security standards.
Familiarity with authentication protocols (SSO, MFA, OAuth) and security frameworks.
Ability to think creatively and analytically when diagnosing and solving problems.
Strong interpersonal skills and a proactive attitude towards internal support.
Professional certifications such as: Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate / Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate / CompTIA Security+ or equivalent / ITIL Foundation (a plus, not required).
Strong English communication skills ‚Äì both spoken and written (international work environment).
Availability to work in a hybrid model ‚Äì 2-3 days/week from our Warsaw office.
Optional
Experience with ISO 27001 certification processes is highly desirable.
offered_section:
What we offer
A challenging, rewarding, and dynamic role in a fast-paced international environment
Ongoing learning and development opportunities.
Competitive compensation package, with B2B contract option available.
Flexible and agile work practices focused on employee wellbeing and innovation.
A hybrid work model with 2‚Äì3 days/week in our modern Warsaw office.
You will have a real, visible impact on the growth and direction of the company.
You'll collaborate with top-tier professionals from the IT and Supply Chain industries.
We foster a "Get Things Done" culture ‚Äî combining thoughtful planning with pragmatic action.
A fun, supportive, and informal atmosphere, where ideas and ownership are encouraged.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
We‚Äôre looking for a technically skilled, service-oriented professional who strives for continuous self-improvement, with a natural curiosity and the ability to learn independently. The ideal candidate brings a positive, can-do attitude, builds strong relationships with both customers and team members, and is motivated to grow within the broadcast technology space. They take ownership of issues, proactively seek solutions.
What does it take to be a Broadcast Support Engineer:
- Contributing to a mission-critical 24/7/365 environment, with potential for off-hours shifts and on-call duties
- Providing remote support to major Evertz customers across various time zones
- Solving problems by replicating user workflows and identifying effective solutions
- Documenting departmental and technical procedures
What you will learn:
- How to act as a bridge between customers and our product development teams
- How to serve as an expert-level specialist on highly complex technical issues
- How to collaborate across multiple teams (engineering, QA, product) in a fast-paced, multinational environment
- How to troubleshoot real-world scenarios involving software, network, and system-level issues
- How to maintain customer satisfaction while handling escalations and technical challenges
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of broadcast technologies is a plus
Ability to explain technical issues to non-technical users
At least 2 years of experience in technical or customer support roles
Experience troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues
Proven ability to operate SLA-driven environments, ensuring timely resolution of technical issues
Advanced knowledge of installations, upgrades and troubleshooting in Unix/Linux and Windows environments
Commercial experience with remote access tools and diagnostic utilities
Willingness to travel to customer sites as needed‚Äì typically up to 10% per year
Openness to attend internal training at our HQ in Canada
Optional
Basic understanding of networking (TCP/IP, DNS, VPNs, firewalls)
Willingness to learn and work with the most advanced solutions in the broadcast industry
College diploma in computer science, engineering, networking, or a related field
description_block:
EVERTZ POLAND SP√ì≈ÅKA Z OGRANICZONƒÑ ODPOWIEDZIALNO≈öCIƒÑ
Scroll to company's profile
Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.
Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Enters and participates in the scope and impact evaluation of an incident into the corporate ticketing system and Incident Tracking System to document the status and resolution of incidents. Annotates the steps taken to reach incident milestones to come up with a technical timeline within the incident tracking system and close the ticket when service has been restored.
Engages, escalates, and communicates notifications as needed to level 3 technical support, management, and critical incident management. Opens Meet Me Lines (MML) for technical teams to gather and begin working towards a resolution.
Coordinates internal technical and business teams in the resolution of incidents impacting client service delivery and in the identification of action plans.
Provides technical feedback for communication to internal and external clients. Assesses incident criteria to determine if formal root cause analysis is needed. Collaborates with Technical resources to determine the root cause of an incident and provides a written incident report within the Client SLA/OLA delivery time. Provides problem management action plans within appropriate timescales; escalates as needed. Assist other Senior Analysts with trend analysis and action recommendations and action tracking.
Ensures all change activities follow appropriate processes for planning and authorization. Ensures supplier change processes are aligned to client contractual requirements. Champions and supports the change management function, ensuring understanding and compliance with standard methods, processes and procedures from all internal and external parties.
Facilitates the service transition process by maintaining the product catalogue in line with current business requirements.
Participates in the continual service improvement process by providing feedback concerning their role and key data points to enhance existing process and service in line with enterprise policy.
Occasionally acts as 24x7 first line Service Desk support

Bachelor's Degree
Relevant Experience or Degree in: Experience with various technologies and IT Services. Major in Computer Science strongly preferred, other majors considered. Willing to accept additional experience in lieu of a degree.
Typically Minimum 2 Years Relevant Exp
Skills / Knowledge - Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.
Job Complexity - Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships.
Supervision - Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments.
Language Skills - Advanced knowledge of English, written and verbal (C1 - C2) and intermediate knowledge of Polish, written and verbal (B1 - B2)
Optional
ITIL Foundations certification

description_block:
Britenet Sp. z o.o.
Przewi≈Ñ do profilu firmy
We are Britenet, we have been operating as a leader in providing IT solutions to clients from all over the world since 2006. We focus on growth in international teams, so we create an interdisciplinary environment to encourage development. We support diversity, believing it is the key to creating innovative solutions.
Already trusted by +200 companies from all over the world, among them the largest Polish and international brands representing many industries such as finance, education, energy, automotive, tourism, lottery or insurance.
We take responsibility for the IT sector. We actively collaborate with universities and non-profit organizations and encourage charity activities. We create an open workplace, removing barriers and promoting non-stereotypical thinking about our industry.
We focus on constant development and expertise. Individually tailored training offerings and career paths are a natural approach for us. As #BritePeople, we actively participate in industry conferences and meetups, sharing our expertise with others.
Making people come first. We are proud that many of our #BritePeople choose to join our company for the long term.

We serve businesses that expect their challenging projects to be delivered according to plan, with impeccable quality, and under strict compliance requirements. Our remote-first team of 100+ experts specializes in building high-quality digital products. We set a new standard in our industry through data-driven decisions, measurable outcomes, a strategic mindset, and a solid work culture.
additional_module_section:
Our values
COMMITMENT - We are dedicated to our team, and work towards achieving our collective goals. We strive to be a trustworthy partner for our clients and to always do the right thing ‚Äì and do it well.
TRANSPARENCY - We are authentic, honest, and respectful. We aim to build healthy relationships based on trust, direct communication, and common goals with both our colleagues and clients.
OWNERSHIP - We are accountable for the results of our actions. We are a team of individual specialists who trust each other and take responsibility for our collective success, according to our roles.
INITIATIVE - We are proactive in our efforts to achieve a goal or solve a problem. We seek out new ways to do whatever is necessary to get the job done.
CURIOSITY - We are constantly improving and learning new things. We stay up-to-date with the latest technology trends. We provide a flexible and practical approach to project requirements. We share our knowledge and keep an open mind.
FELLOWSHIP - We build strong relationships with our colleagues and clients. We create a positive environment where everyone feels comfortable and valued. We keep in mind the feelings of others and support our colleagues in difficult situations.

position_name: Network Security Engineer - Security Tech Tribe
benefit_titles: ['sharing the costs of sports activities', 'private medical care', 'sharing the costs of professional training & courses', 'life insurance', 'remote work opportunities', 'flexible working time', 'corporate products and services at discounted prices', 'mobile phone available for private use', 'no dress code', 'parking space for employees', 'employee referral program', 'charity initiatives']
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Design, implement, and maintain secure network infrastructure (LAN, WAN, Wi-Fi) in alignment with industry best practices.
Configure and manage network and security devices including firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and SSE platforms (e.g., Cisco ASA/FTD, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Zscaler).
Monitor and analyze network traffic and security logs using SIEM platforms and tools such as Wireshark, NetFlow, and tcpdump.
Ensure a high level of security through the application of Zero Trust Architecture, network segmentation, and Network Access Control (NAC).
Implement and support DDoS protection solutions and load balancing technologies.
Identify, assess, and respond to network-level threats, including conducting vulnerability scans and risk assessments.
Ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations (e.g., ISO 27001, NIST, DORA, GDPR).
Participate in change management and patch management processes.
Maintain a strong security mindset and stay updated on emerging cyber threats, attack vectors, and defensive mechanisms.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Technical Skills & Experience
3‚Äì5 years of hands-on experience in network and security engineering roles.
Strong knowledge of network protocols, routing and switching, TCP/IP, UDP, BGP, OSPF, etc.
Experience with SSE, firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and next-generation security appliances (e.g. Cisco ASA/FTD, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Zscaler).
Ability to design, implement, and monitor secure network infrastructure (LAN/WAN/Wi-Fi).
Familiarity with SIEM platforms, log analysis, and security monitoring tools.
Knowledge of NAC (Network Access Control), DDoS protection, and load balancing technologies.
Understanding of Zero Trust Architecture and network segmentation.
Hands-on experience with network troubleshooting tools (Wireshark, NetFlow, tcpdump).
Security Mindset & Best Practices
Deep understanding of cyber threats, network-based attack vectors, and defense mechanisms.
Knowledge of relevant compliance standards (e.g. ISO 27001, NIST, DORA, GDPR).
Ability to perform risk assessments, vulnerability scans, and incident response related to network-level threats.
Familiarity with change management and patch management processes.
Optional
Experience in cloud networking security (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Scripting knowledge (e.g. Python, Bash) to support automation tasks.
Experience working in regulated industries (e.g. finance, healthcare, telecom).
Exposure to OT/ICS security environments is a plus.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
We are looking for a person that will help us to proliferate usage of specialized monitoring solution across our projects. The New Relic tool is used for monitoring and analysing the performance of digital systems, encompassing applications and infrastructure. We need it for real-time insights into system behaviour and identification of potential issues.
Working with New Relic, and especially setting up synthetic monitoring, will be your primary assignment and your contribution to our systems operations and maintenance. You will also participate in our regular daily stand-ups, planning, review, and retrospective meetings.

you are good in English both written and spoken
you have good communication skills
you can collaborate and perform as a team player, but also independently

you can learn quickly

description_block:
Integral Solutions
Scroll to company's profile
We‚Äôre a fast-growing team on a mission to transform strength training at home. Say goodbye to guesswork and compromises‚Äîour solution delivers AI-powered, full-body workouts in a sleek and space-saving design. With smart resistance, expert-led programs, and real-time progress tracking, we‚Äôre making effective strength training accessible, personalized, and part of everyday life.
We‚Äôre over 120 passionate professionals‚Äîdesigners obsessed with precision, engineers solving real-world problems, and training specialists who believe in sustainable progress. Our team brings together experience from leading companies across the tech, fitness, and lifestyle industries, all focused on reimagining strength training from the ground up.
What have we built so far? Over the past few years, we‚Äôve developed a next-generation strength training system that delivers adaptive, intelligent workouts tailored to each user. Now, we‚Äôre expanding‚Äîand looking for exceptional people to help shape the future of fitness.
additional_module_section:
If you're excited about shaping the future of fitness and want to work with a forward-thinking team, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.
Apply now and help us set a new standard in strength training.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Take accountability for key Marketing Platforms which include e.g. Adobe Marketo, Sitecore CMS, SharePoint sites, and manage technical resolution of escalated live-service issues.
Technically support the full suite of EMEA Marketing applications, including SaaS products, ensuring operational efficiency, reliability, and scalability of all tools used by the marketing team.
Build technical awareness and understanding of the various integrations between EMEA Marketing applications and the wider Colliers IT Landscape so that issues / change can be effectively managed.
Provide technical guidance on changes to introduce new features and improvements, liaising with the appropriate teams to gain approvals.
Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to identify, troubleshoot and optimise lead-flow issues and lead assignment rules between Marketo & Salesforce.
Act as a data accuracy ambassador, fostering effective collaboration between the Head of Digital Marketing and the Head of Data, to ensure streamlined data workflows to identify best practices and scalable success across the organization.
Build collaborative working relationships with the Salesforce CoE and Marketo CoE ensuring knowledge is effectively transferred and that technical governance around the Marketo platform is understood and observed.
Support marketing system upgrades in conjunction with Colliers Technology team and wider stakeholders.
Work with the Colliers Service Delivery Team to align with ITIL standards in respect of support / change / problem / incident management and ensure that any 3rd party providing extended Application Support Services operates within the EMEA Service Delivery model.
Create and maintain solution documentation including technical designs, project plans, workflows and training documents.
Liaise with the wider EMEA IT Team on SaaS security audits and both DR and Business continuity planning as and when necessary.
Work with the Marketo Business Product Owner (in Marketing) to ensure that there is an agreed and prioritised backlog of functional enhancements / changes with a delivery timetable for Development / Test and Release (a shared Roadmap of improvements).
Ensure focus on achieving GDPR compliance in collaboration with the Business Product Owner.
Facilitate the design and implementation of automated reporting processes, ensuring marketing teams have access to accurate, timely performance data.
Support where necessary optimisation of Marketo campaigns including email template setup, campaign setup, landing/web pages, lead nurture, event promotion, A/B testing, scheduling, tracking and measuring campaign performance.
Support the integration of reporting data from multiple tools and translate this information into actionable insights using Power BI dashboards.
Collaborate with marketing leadership in assessing, reviewing, and optimising the current marketing technology ecosystem to ensure scalability, best practice, and return on investment.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Detailed knowledge of marketing systems, with the ability to design, implement and support sophisticated marketing automation solutions that increase efficiency and drive impact.
Hands-on experience of Marketo administration including Adds/Moves/Changes would be advantageous.
Social media integration (LinkedIn, and META).
Digital analytics ‚Äì Google Analytics and Power BI dashboards.
CMS experience with Sitecore would be advantageous.
Demonstrate the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, multicultural environment, adapting to diverse ways of working across the EMEA region.
Collaborate with stakeholders at varying levels of digital maturity, ensuring alignment and support tailored to both advanced and developing markets.
Previous experience within the Real Estate industry (desirable).
Strong understanding of email marketing best practices and campaign execution.
Basic HTML & CSS skills for making edits to emails and landing pages.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines.
Proven experience in application integration, preferably in a complex enterprise environment that is a combination of Cloud and on-premise applications.

description_block:
Colliers Poland Sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Colliers is a leading diversified professional services and investment management company. With operations in 68 countries, our 22,000 enterprising people work collaboratively to provide expert advice to maximize the potential of property and real assets to accelerate the success of our clients, our investors, and our people.
We are at the forefront of the real estate industry, leading the way and backed by an exceptional record of success. We are building for our future ‚Äì and yours.
We strive to build our business at a competitive pace by augmenting internal growth with smart strategic acquisitions that increase market share, expand service offerings, and extend our geographic reach for the benefit of our clients and shareholders.
For more than 27 years, Colliers has created value for shareholders that has resulted in superior returns and industry growth. Our people also own significant equity in our business, which brings pride of ownership to everything we do. We are passionate, take personal responsibility and always do what's right for our clients, people, and communities.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Designing, building, and optimizing backend infrastructure for scalability and performance.
Implementing and enhancing microservice and serverless architectures on AWS.
Working with generative AI technologies and large language models (LLMs) to deliver innovative features.
Collaborating with senior backend engineers on platform components, ensuring reliability and robustness.
Working with product and frontend teams to deliver customer-oriented solutions.
Utilizing and continuously improving CI/CD processes with a focus on automation and quality assurance.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Minimum 4+ years of experience developing production systems in Python.
2+ years of experience working with cloud technologies (AWS preferred).
Experience working in Linux environments.
2+ years of experience with CI/CD frameworks (Github Actions preferred).
Familiarity with serverless and microservice architectures.
We are looking for someone with experience ‚Äî even non-commercial ‚Äî in projects involving AI, and who is comfortable using coding-support tools such as Cursor or similar.
Fluent English is essential.
Strong ability to work under pressure and quickly adapt to changing conditions in a startup environment.
Optional
Experience working in a startup environment ‚Äì highly desirable.
Experience working with Golang (preferably large systems or web applications).
Experience in system development with a focus on architecture and strategy.
Experience implementing LLM technologies in production systems.
offered_section:
What we offer
Work environment with zero micromanagement - we cherish autonomy
100% remote work (unless you want to work from our HQ Gdynia), recruitment & onboarding
Really cool seaside apartment available for free for both leisure & work
Private medical insurance and Multisport
We want you to join our team. We are neither the agency giving you projects from time to time, nor huge corporation where you are a "dev XYZ". At Idego - you matter!

So in general: we have fun combined with a lot of sanity. üôÇ

In Warsaw SIX combines Swiss working culture with attractive job opportunities in the world of finance and IT. Since we opened our office in Poland in 2017, we are continuously growing and hiring. We offer you wide range of career opportunities in the center of Warsaw in a modern office space close to Rondo Daszy≈Ñskiego.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Be responsible for the overall customer engagement from initial consulting, discovery, and scoping, through the solution delivery and further account expansion.
Be responsible for engagement profitability and customer satisfaction.
Creating and overseeing technical solutions across key areas: Infrastructure as Code, DevOps automation, Spacelift implementation, and cloud security.
Doing proposal preparation and project delivery processes.
Creating and presenting technical documentation (architecture designs, implementation plans, security reviews).
Growing business with existing accounts and generating leads in your technology area.
Acting as a trusted advisor for enterprise customers migrating from other IaC runners to Spacelift.

Experience working with large organizations
Knowledge of cloud implementations and DevOps realities is a plus, but technical expertise is not required
Experience in multi-cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience in delivering presentations and facilitating workshops for decision-making groups
Ability to prepare comprehensive technical proposals and scope of work documents
Excellent communication skills with both technical teams and business stakeholders
English is required

description_block:
SEMANTIVE CLOUD sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
We are an independent multi-cloud services company that helps enterprises and SMB companies build new foundations for future growth through successful cloud transformation and breadth of expertise in applying cloud technologies to unlock new possibilities. Today's digital and technological revolution is an important part of our business - we are not only adapting to it, but also taking an active part in creating and supporting companies in overcoming the associated challenges.‚Äç
Our goal is to see the client from their perspective, build relationships based on mutual benefit, and contribute to the efficiency and optimization of clients' businesses.
We are 45+ people, with high seniority, and we specialize in solutions that help our clients in digital transformation. Our company focuses on long-term relationships and offers the opportunity to actively influence the development of the organization. We create an inspiring atmosphere based on transparency and cooperation.
additional_module_section:
Let's start with what we don't need: someone who just "does technical consulting." We need a person who understands that technology is a crucial business enabler for enterprise organizations. Someone who thinks in terms of business outcomes, measures the impact of their technical solutions, and isn't afraid to innovate.
If you ask about your goal, the answer is: we want to grow our Infrastructure as Code automation professional services, build strong recognition as world-class experts in IaC (Terraform, OpenTofu, Spacelift, and others), and deliver transformative value to enterprise customers.

ZF Group

ZF is a global technology company supplying systems for passenger cars, commercial vehicles and industrial technology, enabling the next generation of mobility.ZF allows vehicles to see, think and act. In the four technology domains of Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving, and Electric Mobility, ZF offers comprehensive product and software solutions for established vehicle manufacturers and newly emerging transport and mobility service providers. ZF electrifies a wide range of vehicle types. With its products, the company contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate and enhancing safe mobility.

Our goal is to see the client from their perspective, build relationships based on mutual benefit, and contribute to the efficiency and optimization of clients' businesses.

Building on our shared company values ‚Äì accountability, expertise and partnership - NATEK's mission is to deliver high quality IT outsourcing and consulting services in the CEE region. employer_name: Maxima Europe Sp. z.o.o.About the company
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Develop and optimize machine learning models for our recommendation engine and e-commerce products using C# and Python.
Improve and maintain existing models to ensure performance, scalability, and robustness in production.
Gain proficiency in our proprietary domain-specific programming language used for key recommendation engine components.
Design and maintain data pipelines and API integrations to support real-time and batch processing of behavioral data.
Assist in debugging and troubleshooting data science-related issues in collaboration with the Support and Engineering teams.
Proactively contribute to research and specification phases with Product Managers to explore new product opportunities.
Collaborate with backend developers, UX/UI designers, product managers, and customer service teams to align data science solutions with business needs.
Present complex data insights in an accessible way to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively analyze behavioral data to identify and validate new business opportunities for customers.
Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code following software engineering best practices.
Ensure high-quality standards through testing, documentation, and continuous integration workflows.
Conduct code reviews and provide support to team members to improve code quality and maintainability.
Actively contribute to discussions on mathematical approaches and data science methodologies to improve team workflows.
Coach and mentor junior data scientists, fostering a collaborative and learning-focused environment.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or related fields. And candidates with a strong backend development background (e.g., .NET/Azure/Python) and experience in transitioning into data science.
Experience in end-to-end data science projects, including model development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
Strong mathematical modeling and statistical skills, with a focus on software-level implementation.
Ready to work primarily on improving and maintaining current solutions on source code level.
A good sense of balance between model complexity, generalization, scalability, performance, and maintenance costs under an agile and continuous development cycle.
Proficiency in Python for statistical programming and general-purpose development in C#.
Experience with Azure infrastructure, including Kubernetes and Azure Pipelines.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain data-driven insights to diverse audiences.
An ability to take charge of your own projects as well as close collaboration with others.
Proactive, self-disciplined, and highly motivated with well-organized work style
Excellent English (verbal and written)
Optional
Experience with: DevOps, Docker, Kubernetes, Databricks, Cassandra, SQL.
Experience with Delta Lake and Spark for handling large-scale data.
Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs) and other NLP technologies in a multi-agent system.
Background in eCommerce product development.
Experience in developing recommendation systems.
Hands-on experience with deep learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow, MXNet).
Proficiency with Git
offered_section:
What we offer
Fair salary based on your experience
Training budget and learning opportunities - access to internal trainings
Flexible working hours
Remote work
Paid days off and bank holidays
Refundation of luxmed and multisport
Industry conferences.
description_block:
Maxima Europe Sp. z.o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Global challenges and evolving customer demands call for global talent strategies and international teams. This is why all major companies and many SMEs work with IT outsourcing and consultancy partners such as Maxima Consulting. Our technology consultants utilize their knowledge and skills to become trusted advisors to clients in multiple industries. They deliver cutting-edge solutions tailored to client‚Äôs individual business needs, support and coach their in-house IT teams, and champion innovation.
Maxima Consulting is proud to be a people-centric organization where all employees are valued and recognized as a leading company strength. We are a team of long-term thinkers focused on sustainability and growth and have a track record of long-lasting partnerships with our clients and consultants alike. You are welcome here regardless of your gender, religion, location, age, and any other personal characteristics.
additional_module_section:
Recruitment process flow
We respect your time and effort, so our recruitment process is as short and convenient as possible. Our recruiters are committed to keeping you in the loop and will happily answer your questions to help you prepare or clarify our expectations.
1. You apply for a job.
2. We review your profile to ensure you‚Äôre going for an opening that suits you best.
3. You meet our recruiter online for an introductory interview.
4. You meet your future team members for an interview so you can demonstrate your skills.
5. You receive a job offer. Welcome aboard!

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Write and develop AI code in Python using the latest LLM solutions and Natural Language Processing (NLP) libraries
Help choose the tools we'll use to develop artificial intelligence in the project
Create, test, develop, iterate, and sometimes discard new tools and production code
Maintain implemented tools and ensure their stability (e.g., latest LLM models, tools for models)
Monitor the completeness and consistency of data provided to our AI model
Write prompts that will make the LLM communicate exactly the way we need it to
Help others in the company understand your work and the dependencies between the AI code and the rest of the game code
requirements_section:
Our requirements
You have at least 5 years of experience writing Python code for commercial digital products
Have in-depth knowledge of the capabilities and limitations of the latest solutions in LLMs and Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Can write clean and readable code
Regularly use AI support you in your work
Like to work independently and don't need hand-holding while performing tasks
Can communicate fluently in English
Are a gamer and love games
Optional
Experience in writing and maintaining AI agents
Experience in building and maintaining data warehouses
offered_section:
What we offer
Gaming Industry Entry: A chance to break into the gaming industry, no dress code, cool people, and a friendly atmosphere
Flexible Contract Options: Choose between an employment contract or B2B
Work-Life Balance: Flexible working hours and the option to work remotely or on-site in our Krakow office
Professional Development: Opportunities to attend industry conferences and trainings
Team Events: Regular team and company-wide events
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive social package including a multi-sport card, Lux-Med medical care, language classes, and a well-stocked kitchen with coffee, fruit, and popcorn
Eco-Friendly Initiatives: We encourage eco-friendly commuting and even offer a stipend for biking to work

Fun Crafters
Scroll to company's profile
At Fun Crafters, we're not just another gaming company; we're a passionate community of gaming enthusiasts and innovators with over a decade of expertise in crafting engaging mobile games. With a mission to create unforgettable gaming experiences, we've carved our path in the gaming industry.
Join us to unleash your creativity, shape the future of mobile gaming, and be part of a team where your ideas matter.
Welcome to a world where fun knows no bounds!

Project work (partly project management) with a focus on SAP HCM personnel cost planning & SAP HCM organizational management, including the implementation of the conception.
Development and maintenance of SAP organizational management.
Implementation and maintenance of personnel cost planning and simulation planning.
Full-time/FTE consideration in the context of personnel cost planning (job planning in the public sector and in the healthcare sector).

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Leverage advanced statistical methods on massive, complex datasets to extract insights from billions of events and thousands of features across different organizational sources.
Develop and deploy automated solutions, ranging from SQL query automation to real-time Python classification and ML modeling, to address key strategic challenges.

Collaborate with stakeholders in cross-projects and team settings to identify and clarify business or product questions to answer. Provide feedback to translate and refine business questions into tractable analysis, evaluation metrics, or mathematical models.
Use custom data infrastructure or existing data models as appropriate, using specialized knowledge. Design and evaluate models to mathematically express and solve defined problems with limited precedent.

description_block:
BEC Poland
Scroll to company's profile
BEC is a financial technology company creating IT solutions for Danish banks. Together, we enable their customers to invest online, take out loans and transfer money. In other words, everything it takes to run a bank.
We have 1,700+ employees spread across five locations in Denmark and Poland. We collaborate in a flat hierarchy with a high degree of mutual trust. Here, great ideas have no rank, and we invite everybody to chip in to create the strongest banking solutions for Danish society.

responsibilities_section:

Proficient use of AWS services, including but not limited to S3, Step Functions, Lambda, Fargate, AWS Glue, RDS. Strong hands-on experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including the design and implementation of ETL solutions using AWS technologies.

description_block:
SQUARE ONE RESOURCES sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
At Square One Poland we link IT experts with the business. With over 25 years of experience, we specialize in recruitment processes on a global scale. responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Manage response to reported product security incidents (detected internally or by customers).
Prepare analysis and risk assessment for product security issues.
Support customers security audits.
Assure Security Tests are embedded into product development process.
Support definition and prioritization of the work cascaded to development teams in context of Secure System Design.
Sharing knowledge and experience with development teams regarding Product Security.
Prepare Security reports based on executed tests and vulnerabilities status.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Information Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent education required.
At least 4 years of experience with IT R&D products development.
Proven professional experience with the development of software products security.
Good understanding of DAST, SAST, Pen Tests.
Experience in working with SCA tools and Security Scanners (i.e. Black Duck, Trivy, Grype, Nessus, Defensix, nmap, CIS Benchmark Scan)
Good understanding of CVEs and ability to assess of impact on developed product.
Good understanding of OS and containers hardening (practical experience in this aspect will be advantage).
Experience in processes definition and introduction into organization.
Ability to manage your own tasks and priorities efficiently.
Strong coordination skills in handling tasks delegated to external teams.
Excellent teamwork abilities and effectiveness in cross-site communication.
At least B2 English and B2 Polish proficiency level.
Optional
Good understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) aspects.
Ability to utilize SBOMs and OpenAPI for security testing.
Ability to automate the tasks (preferred hands-on experience with Python and bash scripting).
Experience in developing containerized applications (Docker or equivalent).
Experience in developing web-based applications.
Understanding of containerized applications composition, deployment, and orchestration.
Basic knowledge of telecommunication networks or device management applications would be advantage.
offered_section:
What we offer
Stable employment conditions based on an employment contract (turnover rate below 4%)
1 additional vacation day for all, and 1 extra after 10 years being with us.
Flexible working hours and hybrid work (presence in the office in Gdynia 3 days a week)
English lessons during working hours
Internal training program to support your training needs.
Paid employee referral program.
Multisport Card
3% employer contribution to PPK
Private Health Care at Medicover (extended package for employees and possibility to enroll family members)
Strong collaborative and friendly work culture
Access to various sports activities and events
Modern office (well-equipped gym and playroom) close to the SKM/PKM stations

ADTRAN is seeking a Product Security Engineer for Mosaic Network Controller network management system.
Our system manages WDM Optical, Ethernet, and Synchronization and Timing networks, ensuring our customers' success in operating their solutions. Our solutions are used globally by Tier 1 Network Service Providers, Regional Service Providers, Data Center Operators, and various Enterprises that prioritize system security, network speed, performance, and reliability.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Conduct comprehensive analysis of business processes to identify opportunities for improvements, optimization, or automation, assessing the benefits and impacts of these improvements on business KPIs.
Develop and implement process improvements based on the conducted analysis to enhance their efficiency and quality.
Design and deploy process automations using advanced analytical and data visualization tools and in collaboration with other cross-functional teams (RPA, Data, IT).
Support business teams in process optimization by providing data analysis, process mapping (as-is and to-be), as well as creating and managing project documentation.
Lead change management efforts within the organization, effectively communicating the strategies and benefits of reengineering projects to all stakeholders.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Education: Bachelor's degree, preferably in Management, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Professional Experience:
‚úÖMinimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role, involving process optimization, automation, or internal project management within a large, international organization.
‚úÖDocumented successes in implementing effective process changes that have delivered measurable benefits to previous employers.
‚úÖFamiliarity with BPMN, along with experience working with business process modelling and analysis tools such as Adonis, Visio, ARIS or similar.
Technical Skills:
‚úÖProficiency with advanced data analysis tools, especially advanced Excel and Power BI knowledge.
‚úÖBasic knowledge of at least one programming language used in data analysis and processing (Python, VBA, M, etc.).
‚úÖExperience in using basic RPA tools like Power Automate or Power Apps.
Soft Skills:
‚úÖExcellent written and verbal communication skills.
‚úÖAbility to work in a team and manage stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
‚úÖStrong analytical and problem-solving skills.
‚úÖAbility to manage change and organizational resistance.
‚úÖProactive approach to risk management and problem anticipation.
Language: Fluent English (written and spoken), enabling effective communication in an international environment.
Optional
‚úÖAny certifications related to business process management (e.g., Six Sigma, Lean Management).
‚úÖExperience in writing SQL queries and working with large datasets.
‚úÖFamiliarity with Databricks and Azure Data Lake.
‚úÖFamiliarity with SAP ERP system.
‚úÖKnowledge of any advanced RPA platforms such as UiPath.
‚úÖExperience with data and process mining tools like Signavio or Celonis.
‚úÖProfessional experience in the logistics or financial industry.
‚úÖA working knowledge of an additional foreign language (French, Italian, or Spanish).
offered_section:
What we offer
Opportunity to work alongside senior leadership in a fast-growing international environment.
A comprehensive benefits package, including private healthcare and a sports card.
Flexible working arrangements, including hybrid work model.
Career development opportunities through professional training and international exposure.
description_block:
InPost
Scroll to company's profile
As a Process Improvement Senior Specialist you will be responsible for analysing and redesigning business processes to enhance efficiency and reduce costs across the organization, particularly in Finances. Your duties will include mapping current processes, identifying inefficiencies and proposing innovative solutions that leverage technology and best practices. You will monitor the outcomes of reengineered processes to validate improvements and adjust strategies as needed to maximize operational effectiveness. Additionally, you will support business providing process automations. This role spans across Poland and extends to 7 international markets, offering a unique opportunity to support our constant expansion.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Enterprise Activity Management team is a part of Box's Enterprise Engineering organization. Our main customers are 200K+ enterprise admins, whose responsibilities are to set up and configure Box apps for their enterprises, onboard and migrate users, set rules and permissions for users, groups, files, and folders within their orgs, and run reports. Therefore our team has two major domains: Insights&Reports (I&R), and Users&Groups (U&G).
requirements_section:
Our requirements
3+ years of professional software development experience
Proficient in Java and Spring Boot
Experience designing and developing APIs and microservices
You possess strong knowledge of algorithms, data structures, software design principles, and object-oriented programming
Assess, communicate and complete project milestones with manager and team members in a time sensitive manner
Adapt to the technical and stylistic needs of integrations and projects as they occur; including technical tools, programming languages, technical limitations, and product requirements
Review and assess the technical feasibility of project requirements and propose innovative solutions
Be the technical expert and provide guidance to junior engineers on best practices, coding standards, and complex technical issues
Must speak English proficiently
Optional
Experience in PHP or Scala is a plus
Experience with public cloud systems such as GCP
Experience contributing to open source project
description_block:
Box Poland sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Box is the world‚Äôs leader in Intelligent Content Management. We are trusted by more than 115K organizations around the world today, including nearly 70% of the Fortune 500 and leaders across deeply regulated industries (such as AstraZeneca, JLL, and Nationwide), to protect their data, fuel collaboration, and power critical workflows with secure, enterprise AI.
By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to continue driving our platform forward. Content powers how we work. It‚Äôs the billions of files and information flowing across teams, departments, and key business processes every single day: contracts, invoices, employee records, financials, product specs, marketing assets, and more. Our mission is to bring intelligence to the world of content management and empower our customers to completely transform workflows across their organizations. With the combination of AI and enterprise content, the opportunity has never been greater to transform how the world works together and at Box you will be on the front lines of this massive shift.
Founded in 2005, Box is headquartered in Redwood City, CA, and we have offices across the United States, Europe, and Asia.
additional_module_section: Box lives its values, with community and in-person collaboration being a core part of our culture. Boxers are expected to work from their assigned office a minimum of 2 days per week, with a focus on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Your Recruiter will share more about how we work and company culture during the hiring process.

description_block:
Netcompany Poland sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Netcompany was founded in 2000 and has its headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark. Today, we are an international company with more than 8200 employees working from 10 locations. We serve a wide array of customers in their digital transformation journeys in the public and private sectors across Europe.
At Netcompany we are excited by the challenge of doing things differently. We rely on one another and we develop quickly. From assisting small businesses to undertaking significant government projects, our innovative IT solutions are making a difference. Our culture emphasizes agility and flexibility, with minimal bureaucracy. Take a look at some of our impactful projects here: https://netcompany.com/cases/
As we prepare for new ventures, we are seeking ambitious individuals to join us on this journey.
At Netcompany, we focus on your personal and professional development.
When you join us, you will be assigned a personal mentor who will guide you through your development and assist you in achieving your goals. The close relationship with an experienced colleague ensures your well-being and provides you with concrete insights into the many different career opportunities as you build your experience.
Furthermore, you will participate in our training program, Netcompany Academy, where you will be offered courses and seminars on everything from technologies, and management to communication. All courses are taught by experienced Netcompany colleagues, which ensures that all content is highly relevant and builds upon your expertise, allowing you to be well-prepared to handle various tasks and continually improve throughout your career with us.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
We‚Äôre looking for a mid- to senior-level engineer who‚Äôs equally at home crafting Angular front ends and Java back-end APIs. In this full-time freelance role, you‚Äôll do more than just code; you‚Äôll communicate directly with clients and help shape the architecture of our solutions.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
At least 5 years of professional software development experience, including:
3+ years with Angular
3+ years with Java Spring Boot.
Strong verbal and written English communication skills (B2+ level), with the ability to talk directly with clients in online meetings.
Ability to deliver high-quality service and work independently.
Availability of at least 40 hours per week.
Solid programming fundamentals and understanding of best practices (e.g., DRY, KISS, abstraction, refactoring, optimization, security).
Strong knowledge of Vanilla JavaScript (ES6+).
Advanced proficiency with Angular v18+.
Deep understanding of Dependency Injection and Angular Signals.
Experience with new Angular Control Flow (@if, @for, @switch).
Familiarity with Standalone Components and NgModule-free architecture.
Experience with @defer and performance-focused reactive patterns.
Proficient with RxJS and state management.
Strong command of Java and Spring Boot.
Familiarity with non-relational databases like MongoDB.
Experience building RESTful APIs and working with microservices.
Understanding of Java concurrency and multi-threading.
Experience with testing frameworks like JUnit and Mockito.
Familiarity with Spring Security for authentication and authorization.
Proficiency with build tools such as Maven or Gradle.
Experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration platforms (e.g., Kubernetes).
Good understanding of logging and monitoring tools for Java apps (e.g., SLF4J, Logback, ELK stack).
Optional
Experience with C++ API development for high-performance services or native integrations.
Familiarity with Carbon Design System or other enterprise-grade component libraries.
offered_section:
What we offer
Freelance opportunity: Enjoy the flexibility of a freelance contract and earn between $25 and $35 USD per hour, depending on your experience and expertise.
Room to grow: We support continuous learning and professional development to help you advance your career.
Make an impact: Your ideas and work will directly influence our direction and help drive meaningful change.
Diverse projects: Work on exciting projects for startups, agencies, and companies based in the US, UK, and Australia.
Work your way: Choose to work from home, your favorite coffee shop, or our Krak√≥w office (we‚Äôve got a nice parking space too!).
Set your schedule: Work the hours that suit you best, as long as there's some overlap with the team and clients.
Transparency: We‚Äôre open and honest about the company‚Äôs decisions, direction, and performance, so you‚Äôre always in the loop.
Supportive team: You‚Äôll never be left alone. Our team is collaborative and always ready to help each other.
Great vibes: Join a team of open-minded, fun, and friendly people who enjoy what they do.
Stay connected: Participate in social events, both online and in person, to stay engaged and build connections.

description_block:
ZOOLA TECH POLAND sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Zoolatech is a Software development company. Now we have around 400 team members in Ukraine, Mexico, Turkey, Poland and we continue to grow.
Zoolatech was founded on the idea of creating a harmonious, collaborative environment for all of our team members and our clients that, once they have discovered it, they will never want to leave. We are building a family-like atmosphere where clients and team members act as partners and share common goals.
Our clients are awesome people who like what they do, so we work hard to make their products incredible. We help them achieve their desires and dreams.
We work with big enterprises and small startups from the USA and Europe. Our customers make the world better in many areas: Retail, Media & Entertainment, Logistics, FinTech, Renewable Energy, Healthcare, Agriculture, Construction & Real Estate, Travel & Hospitality and High Tech.
Mission: Our mission is to create an environment of professionalism and friendliness that will provide an excellent working environment for employees and outstanding service for the clients.
At Zoolatech, everyone creates their own story: it can be about complex architecture, sports, a full and healthy life, or something completely new and exciting that you will bring to us and unite others around it.
We have values that our employees and clients share:
Extreme Ownership
- We own everything within our reach: our work, our results, our relations with coworkers and clients, our careers and professional growth
- We don't blame others and circumstances
- We face challenges, and we‚Äôre not hesitant to ask for help when needed
Learn from Failure
- We love learning and dare to try making things differently and better
- We are smart not to make the same mistake for the second time
- We prefer taking risks and actions to staying still
Speak Up
- We care for what is going on within our reach
- We know we are empowered to make a change
- We do not pretend nothing happens when we see mediocrity, injustice, or plain indifference
Zoola Clients
- We want our clients to be with us forever
- We religiously believe that the only way to our success is our clients success
- We care about the products we work on, and about people who use it
Live a Full, Healthy Life.
- We measure success by the value delivered, not the time spent working
- We care about our physical and mental health
- We believe that happy and healthy people are more productive.

description_block:
ZOOLA TECH POLAND sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Zoolatech is a Software development company. Now we have around 400 team members in Ukraine, Mexico, Turkey, Poland and we continue to grow.
Zoolatech was founded on the idea of creating a harmonious, collaborative environment for all of our team members and our clients that, once they have discovered it, they will never want to leave. We are building a family-like atmosphere where clients and team members act as partners and share common goals.
Our clients are awesome people who like what they do, so we work hard to make their products incredible. We help them achieve their desires and dreams.
We work with big enterprises and small startups from the USA and Europe. Our customers make the world better in many areas: Retail, Media & Entertainment, Logistics, FinTech, Renewable Energy, Healthcare, Agriculture, Construction & Real Estate, Travel & Hospitality and High Tech.
Mission: Our mission is to create an environment of professionalism and friendliness that will provide an excellent working environment for employees and outstanding service for the clients.
At Zoolatech, everyone creates their own story: it can be about complex architecture, sports, a full and healthy life, or something completely new and exciting that you will bring to us and unite others around it.
We have values that our employees and clients share:
Extreme Ownership
- We own everything within our reach: our work, our results, our relations with coworkers and clients, our careers and professional growth
- We don't blame others and circumstances
- We face challenges, and we‚Äôre not hesitant to ask for help when needed
Learn from Failure
- We love learning and dare to try making things differently and better
- We are smart not to make the same mistake for the second time
- We prefer taking risks and actions to staying still
Speak Up
- We care for what is going on within our reach
- We know we are empowered to make a change
- We do not pretend nothing happens when we see mediocrity, injustice, or plain indifference
Zoola Clients
- We want our clients to be with us forever
- We religiously believe that the only way to our success is our clients success
- We care about the products we work on, and about people who use it
Live a Full, Healthy Life.
- We measure success by the value delivered, not the time spent working
- We care about our physical and mental health
- We believe that happy and healthy people are more productive.

description_block:
ITDS Polska Sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
ITDS supports financial service providers to take the next steps.
We identify what‚Äôs possible, every day. Opportunities in the areas of technology, organization, and digitization.
We see where banks, insurers, payment companies, or fintech can go and how they can get there.
That‚Äôs why we want to stimulate you to ramp up your ambition. Forget what you perceive as restraints and step towards the new reality.
ITDS in Poland - Pure player in new Technologies & Financial Industry
+300 IT implementation professionals
+20 clients in the Banking, Insurance, Payment & Fintech Industry
ITDS excels in digital strategy delivery and implementation of best-of-breed lending solutions. ITDS has delivered successful strategic projects throughout Europe since 1998. We combine the experience we‚Äôve accumulated with in-depth knowledge of technologies, business processes, and EU legislation to unlock new business opportunities.

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Support the preparation, execution, and follow-up of PI Planning with a focus on your team's contribution,
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the workflow within your team,
Play a significant role in the formation, composition, and development of high-performing teams,
Support employees in the agile environment as part of training to become Agile Coaches,
Contribute to the continuous improvement and further development of performance within the ART (Agile Release Train),
Identify and remove impediments that hinder the team's progress.
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Effectively navigated resistance to change and guided teams through successful transitions to agile methodologies,
A strong understanding of team dynamics and the ability to analyze team interactions to address potential conflicts constructively, fostering a collaborative and positive environment,
The ability to communicate effectively with diverse stakeholders, including product owners, developers, and management, to ensure clear understanding, alignment, and manage expectations effectively,
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to proactively identify and resolve roadblocks to team progress,
A solid understanding of Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe),
A proactive approach to identifying areas for improvement and implementing change,
Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively to ensure timely delivery of tasks and projects,
Experience in breaking down hierarchical working styles and fostering a collaborative environment,
University degree and are fluent in German and English,
2+ years of experience as a Scrum Master or Agile Coach in a multicultural organization, with expertise in Scaled Agile Framework,
A strong understanding of various agile methodologies and the ability to adapt your approach to different contexts.
Optional
Certifications in Scrum/Agile methodologies,
Experience with Team Building Workshops and Ceremonies Playbook,
Conflict solving skills, ability to support others' professional development and experience in people and team management.
offered_section:
What we offer
Work flexibility - hybrid working model, flexible start of the day, workation, sabbatical leave,
Development and upskilling - our full support during onboarding process, mentoring from experienced colleagues, training sessions, workshops, certification co/financed by PwC and conversations with native speaker,
Wide medical and wellbeing program - medical care package (incl. dental care, freedom of treatment, physiotherapy), coaching, mindfulness, psychological support, education through dedicated webinars and workshops, financial and legal counseling,
Possibility to create your individual benefits package (a.o. lunch pass, insurance packages, concierge, veterinary package for a pet, massages) and access to a cafeteria - vouchers, discounts on IT equipment and car purchase,
3 paid hours for volunteering per month,
Additional paid Birthday Day off,
And when you start enjoying PwC as much as we do, you may recommend your friend to work with us.

Additional paid Birthday Day off,
And when you start enjoying PwC as much as we do, you may recommend your friend to work with us.

position_name: Machine Learning Engineer in Samsung Ads Project
employer_name: Samsung R&D Institute PolandAbout the company
benefit_titles: ['sharing the costs of sports activities', 'private medical care', 'sharing the costs of foreign language classes', 'life insurance', 'corporate products and services at discounted prices', 'integration events', 'dental care', 'no dress code', 'leisure zone', 'pre-paid cards', 'baby layette', 'charity initiatives', 'unlimited free access to Copernicus Science Center', 'mentoring program', 'psychological support', 'possibility to test new Samsung products']
responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
Develop, test, deploy, and maintain data, scalable low-latency machine learning products and pipelines supporting ML products considering factors such as the nature of the data, the complexity of the problem, and the available computational resources.
Validate the model's performance on unseen data, ensuring that it generalizes well and does not overfit the training data. Conduct rigorous testing to identify and address potential issues, such as bias or fairness concerns.
Design and develop the next generation machine learning platform to support thousands of model training pipelines concurrently and thousands of billions of daily batch predictions.
Research the latest machine learning platform technologies pushing the boundaries of what is currently possible with ML and keep up-to-date with industry trends and developments.
Experiment with new ML platforms tailored to our environment and create quick prototypes / proof-of-concepts.
Streamline model deployment, unit testing, integration testing, and stress testing and ensure engineering quality.
Support automation of the ML pipeline using CI/CD principles, promoting consistency, reproducibility, and agility.
Work with Data Scientists to introduce new ML platform features, help streamline the model development process, and reduce the lead time for model production.
Closely work with different internal ML teams (e.g., Data Scientists and MLOps teams) to improve codebase and product health.
Depending of your skills and experience you will have a chance to technically lead people
requirements_section:
Our requirements
Degree in Computer Science or related field (Data Science, Big Data, Mathematics, Physics, etc.).
At least 2 years of proven industry experience in machine learning projects.
Strong programming skills in Python and data-science libraries (pandas, scikit-learn).
Working knowledge of SQL and relational databases, ideally Snowflake.
Expert knowledge of data analysis, statistics, data mining, machine learning or Big Data processing area.
Experience with mainstream ML libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch, Scikit-Learn, PySpark etc.).
Familiarity with data structures, CI/CD pipelines, software engineering principles and robust code testing.
Collaborating in a team using code versioning tools like Git.
Ability to summarize and present the finding results to business/product stakeholders.
Openness to learn new technologies and adapt to technological stack.
Optional
5+ years of industry (or equivalent) experience in designing and implementing machine learning systems.
Experience in the advertising industry, recommendation systems or real-time bidding (RTB) ecosystem.
Experience in leading a group of developers.
Familiarity with AWS tools (e.g. Airflow, SageMaker), Snowflake, Redis, Aerospike, ETL or big data tools (PySpark/Snowpark, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
Experience with deploying ML models in production.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), orchestration tools (Airflow), building CI/CD pipelines using Github Actions, and real-time monitoring/alerting frameworks such as Prometheus and Grafana.

Friendly atmosphere focused on teamwork
Wide range of trainings and a huge support in developing algorithmic skills
Opportunity to work in multiple projects
Working with the latest technologies on the market
Monthly integration budget

PC workstation/Laptop + 2 external monitors
Office in Warsaw Spire near Metro station
Working in a hybrid model: 3 days from the office per week
Attractive relocation package

DSV is a global leader in the TSL industry, with its headquarters in Denmark. We employ over 160,000 people globally and are present in 90 countries worldwide.

DSV Global Business Services (DSV GBS) in Warsaw is in a phase of dynamic development. We employ more than 1500 fantastic people and this number is constantly increasing.

WHO WE ARE?
ALTEN ‚Äì A Global Leader in Engineering and IT Services

responsibilities_section:
Your responsibilities
As a Java Engineer on the Supply Chain Transportation team, you will be responsible for:
Create frameworks to solve multiple business problems
Responsible for leading design and architecture on projects, write great code
Leads & inspires engineers within the team through design and execution
Takes ownership of solutions, systems, or designs that span multiple people's work, breaking work into smaller tasks for more junior engineers to support.
Influences design within and across teams for projects by providing guidance on software design, development & industry best practices
Diagnose and remedy performance or security issues
Facilitates cross functional troubleshooting, root cause analysis
Surfaces potential design or delivery conflicts in the current product cycle and makes recommendations on the best options.
Demonstrates expertise in industry standards for secure development practices
Expertise with telemetry solutions and products available in the industry
Contributes to community projects and engineering standards
Help mentor junior engineers
requirements_section:
Our requirements
3+ years of professional experience in Java programming language
Strong Knowledge of data structures and distributed systems
Good written and spoken English
Optional
Proficient with Java, Java Spring Boot Framework, and Containerization (Docker/Kubernetes)
Experience with RESTful architecture and microservices
Experience with system design, architecture, scaling and performance testing
Experience with cloud technologies like AWS and/or GCP
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases
Experience with messaging technologies and patterns (Kafka/SQS)
Familiarity with CI/CD, Terraform and testing tools
Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals
Test automation experience at all levels (Unit, Integration, Regression, Load)
Familiarity with ops tools, logging, and metrics (New Relic, Splunk)

What we offer
Paid Vacation
Sick Days
Sport/Insurance Compensation
English Classes
Charity
Training Compensation
description_block:
ZOOLA TECH POLAND sp. z o.o.
Scroll to company's profile
Zoolatech is a Software development company. Now we have around 400 team members in Ukraine, Mexico, Turkey, Poland and we continue to grow.
Zoolatech was founded on the idea of creating a harmonious, collaborative environment for all of our team members and our clients that, once they have discovered it, they will never want to leave. We are building a family-like atmosphere where clients and team members act as partners and share common goals.
Our clients are awesome people who like what they do, so we work hard to make their products incredible. We help them achieve their desires and dreams.
We work with big enterprises and small startups from the USA and Europe. Our customers make the world better in many areas: Retail, Media & Entertainment, Logistics, FinTech, Renewable Energy, Healthcare, Agriculture, Construction & Real Estate, Travel & Hospitality and High Tech.
Mission: Our mission is to create an environment of professionalism and friendliness that will provide an excellent working environment for employees and outstanding service for the clients.
At Zoolatech, everyone creates their own story: it can be about complex architecture, sports, a full and healthy life, or something completely new and exciting that you will bring to us and unite others around it.
We have values that our employees and clients share:
Extreme Ownership
- We own everything within our reach: our work, our results, our relations with coworkers and clients, our careers and professional growth
- We don't blame others and circumstances
- We face challenges, and we‚Äôre not hesitant to ask for help when needed
Learn from Failure
- We love learning and dare to try making things differently and better
- We are smart not to make the same mistake for the second time
- We prefer taking risks and actions to staying still
Speak Up
- We care for what is going on within our reach
- We know we are empowered to make a change
- We do not pretend nothing happens when we see mediocrity, injustice, or plain indifference
Zoola Clients
- We want our clients to be with us forever
- We religiously believe that the only way to our success is our clients success
- We care about the products we work on, and about people who use it
Live a Full, Healthy Life.
- We measure success by the value delivered, not the time spent working
- We care about our physical and mental health
- We believe that happy and healthy people are more productive.

responsibilities_section:

Conduct and participate in design reviews and code reviews.

requirements_section:
